original: 'dir ni cang shes pa zhes bya bas bag tsha ba bzhi med pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni cang shes pa zhes bya bas bag tsha ba bzhi med pa bstan te /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äútamed‚Äù indicates the absence of four fears.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pas bag tsha ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pas bag tsha ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pas bag tsha ba dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pas bag tsha ba'o //
translated: Fear of suffering, fear of danger, fear of worldly concerns, and fear of ignorance.

original: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan 'gror ltung ba dang / 'tsho ba mi 'byor ba dang / chad pas gcad du dogs pa dang / mi snyan par grags su dogs pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams med pa'i phyir 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan 'gror ltung ba dang / 'tsho ba mi 'byor ba dang / chad pas gcad du dogs pa dang / mi snyan par grags su dogs pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams med pa'i phyir 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
translated: Since there is no self-condemnation, no condemnation by others, no falling into miserable realms, no fear of not making a living, no fear of punishment, no fear of a bad reputation, and no fear of death, there is no anxiety about fear.

original: rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang smad pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis gos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang smad pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis gos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no stain of gain and loss, fame and obscurity, praise and blame, pleasure and pain,

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba med do //
translated: there is no anxiety about the worldly concerns.

original: mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang bcas par shes pa dang / log par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang bcas par shes pa dang / log par shes pa med pa'i phyir /

analyzed: mi shes pa'i bag tsha ba med de /

analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i bag tsha ba rnams med pa'i phyir cang shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of such anxiety, they are called ‚Äúfully trained. ‚Äù

original: glang po chen po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo chen po zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: glang po chen po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo chen po zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat elephants‚Äù means ‚Äúgreat leaders. ‚Äù

original: khyad par rtogs pa'i chos thob pa'i phyir glang po chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa'i chos thob pa'i phyir glang po chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúgreat elephants‚Äù because they have attained the Dharma of special understanding.

original: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa zhes bya bas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThey have done their work and laid down their burden‚Äù

analyzed: bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /

translated: Therein, ‚Äúwork‚Äù means that which should not be left undone, the most important thing to be done, which is to be completely liberated from all suffering by perfecting morality, concentration, and wisdom.

analyzed: de dag yongs su rdzogs par byas pa la bya ba byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The completion of that is called ‚Äúhaving done one‚Äôs work. ‚Äù

original: khur bor ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khur bor ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving laid down the burden‚Äù means

analyzed: khur ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / khas 'ches pa'i khur dang / brtson 'grus kyi khur rnams te /

original: bdag gi don rab tu thob pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi don rab tu thob pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bdag gi don thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: rig pa bskyed pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni don du gnyer ba grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of what is advantageous is the attainment of nirvana through the generation of insight.üîΩThe complete destruction of the fetters that bind one to phenomenal existence.

analyzed: srid par sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa dgu gang zhe na /

analyzed: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang / phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: The fetters of views, the fetters of clinging to rules and ritual, the fetter of doubt, the fetter of envy, the fetter of avarice, the fetter of anger,

analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / @6b sred pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun du sbyor ba rnams te /

original: bka' yang dag pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' yang dag pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la bya ste /
analyzed: bka' yang dag pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' yang dag pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is completely liberated by the true teachings‚Äù means that the true teachings of the TathƒÅgata refer to right view.

translated: Since his mind is completely pure, he is called ‚Äúone whose mind is completely liberated by the true teachings.‚Äù

analyzed: sems la dbang thob pas bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la /

analyzed: lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug pa la thags thogs med cing /

original: ji ltar 'dod par mnyam par 'jog nus pas snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la sems dbang du gyur pa yongs su rdzogs shing mthar phyin pa sha stag go zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: the Bodhisattva realizes the destruction of the outflows himself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zag pa zad pa'i shes pa de nyid kyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zag pa zad pa'i shes pa de nyid kyis /
translated: By means of this knowledge of the destruction of the outflows,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas kyang chos de dag gis bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang lhan cig tu gnas kyang chos de dag gis bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the Bodhisattva, although dwelling together with dharmas that have outflows, is not himself defiled by those dharmas.

original: de ltar mngon par shes pa drug po de dag gis sems can gyi don rnam pa sna tshogs pa mdzad pa la mngon par shes pa chen pos rnam par rtse ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par shes pa drug po de dag gis sems can gyi don rnam pa sna tshogs pa mdzad pa la mngon par shes pa chen pos rnam par rtse ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the performance of various kinds of benefit for sentient beings by means of these six supernormal knowledges, it is said that he plays with the great supernormal knowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa shin tu ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag tshe 'phos na yang mngon par shes pa drug po de dag nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa shin tu ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag tshe 'phos na yang mngon par shes pa drug po de dag nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Their superknowledges are not at all impaired means that even when those bodhisattvas pass away, those six superknowledges are not impaired.

original: mngon par shes pa drug po de dag ni byang chub @9b sems dpa' la tshe rabs thams cad du med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug po de dag ni byang chub @9b sems dpa' la tshe rabs thams cad du med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those six superknowledges are never absent from the bodhisattvas in any of their lives.

original: brgya la dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes na yang nyams shing med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa shin tu ma nyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brgya la dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes na yang nyams shing med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa shin tu ma nyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even if they are born in the animal world, they are not impaired and do not disappear. Therefore it is said that their superknowledges are not at all impaired.

original: mnyan par 'os pa'i tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan 'dogs pa gtsor byed pas /
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa'i tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can la phan 'dogs pa gtsor byed pas /
translated: They have words that are worth listening to means that, as bodhisattvas endowed with those six superknowledges, they are concerned with benefiting sentient beings.

original: phan gdags par bya ba'i sems can de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' de dag la rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i ngag nyan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba'i sems can de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' de dag la rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i ngag nyan par 'gyur te /
translated: And those sentient beings who are to be benefited listen to the bodhisattva's words because they naturally love the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gdams shing rjes su bstan pa las srog gi phyir yang 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir mnyan par 'os pa'i tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gdams shing rjes su bstan pa las srog gi phyir yang 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir mnyan par 'os pa'i tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to have words worth hearing because they do not violate the instructions and teachings of the bodhisattvas even at the cost of their lives.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sngon sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i bsod nams kyi mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang don dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na / byang chub sems dpa' sngon sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i bsod nams kyi mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang don dang ldan zhing /
translated: Again, in one sense,

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i tshig 'ba' zhig smra ba'i phyir mnyan par 'os pa'i tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i tshig 'ba' zhig smra ba'i phyir mnyan par 'os pa'i tshig dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas are said to have words worth hearing because they have the power of merit from previously benefiting sentient beings with the four social practices of generosity, pleasant speech, etc., and because the bodhisattvas themselves speak only words that are meaningful and reasonable.

original: le lo med cing brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba la le lo med cing brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: le lo med cing brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba la le lo med cing brtson 'grus brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase without laziness, having undertaken perseverance means that one is without laziness in bringing about the perfection of one's own and others' goals, and that one has undertaken perseverance.

original: lus dang srog la mi lta ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos btsal ba dang / sems can gyi don gyi phyir lus dang srog la mi phangs par dam pa'i chos btsal ba dang / sems can gyi don byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos btsal ba dang / sems can gyi don gyi phyir lus dang srog la mi phangs par dam pa'i chos btsal ba dang / sems can gyi don byed pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase without regard for body or life means that one seeks the Dharma and acts for the sake of sentient beings without concern for one's body or life.

original: tshul 'chos pa med pa zhes bya bas ni lus kyi las yongs su dag pas log par 'tsho ba'i skyon med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa med pa zhes bya bas ni lus kyi las yongs su dag pas log par 'tsho ba'i skyon med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase without hypocrisy shows that one's physical actions are pure and that one is free from the fault of wrong livelihood.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir gzhan dag la lus kyi spyod lam 'chos shing zhi ba dang tshul du shis par ston pa ni tshul 'chos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir gzhan dag la lus kyi spyod lam 'chos shing zhi ba dang tshul du shis par ston pa ni tshul 'chos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Hypocrisy is the alteration of one's physical behavior in order to obtain gain and honor, such as displaying a calm and peaceful demeanor to others.

original: kha gsag med pa zhes bya bas ni dag gi skyon med par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kha gsag med pa zhes bya bas ni dag gi skyon med par bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase without flattery shows that one's verbal actions are pure.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir gzhan dag la gcam pa'i tshig smra ba ni kha gsag ces bya'o //üîΩgrags pa dang / khe dang bkur sti'i sems med pa zhes bya ba ni yid @10a * //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir gzhan dag la gcam pa'i tshig smra ba ni kha gsag ces bya'o // grags pa dang / khe dang bkur sti'i sems med pa zhes bya ba ni yid @10a * //
translated: The expression insincere refers to the flattery of others for the sake of gain and honor.

original: kyi las yongs sum dag pa'i skyon med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kyi las yongs sum dag pa'i skyon med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The expression without a mind to fame, gain, or honor indicates the absence of the fault of mental impurity.

original: zang zing med pa'i chos bstan pa zhes bya bas ni sbyor ba yongs su dag pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /üîΩsems can rnams la chos ston na yang snying rje yongs su zin cing shes rab kyis shin tu sbyangs pas /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i chos bstan pa zhes bya bas ni sbyor ba yongs su dag pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste / sems can rnams la chos ston na yang snying rje yongs su zin cing shes rab kyis shin tu sbyangs pas /
translated: The expression teaching the Dharma without material desire indicates the quality of pure application.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa'i sems med pa la zang zing med pa'i chos ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa'i sems med pa la zang zing med pa'i chos ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even when teaching the Dharma to sentient beings, because of being seized by compassion and purified by wisdom, the absence of a mind attached to gain and honor is called teaching the Dharma without material desire.

original: 'di yan chad kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa man chad rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'i yon tan rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yan chad kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa man chad rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'i yon tan rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, the qualities of the bodhisattvas from the seventh stage onward, who practice with effort and in the absence of signs, have been taught.

original: chos zab mo'i bzod pa dam pa rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chad rtsol pa med cing mtshan ma med par gnas pa rnams kyi yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos zab mo'i bzod pa dam pa rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa yan chad rtsol pa med cing mtshan ma med par gnas pa rnams kyi yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey have realized the highest acceptance of the profound Dharma‚Äù and so forth teaches the qualities of the bodhisattvas who, from the eighth ground on, abide effortlessly and without signs.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa yan chad ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba thams cad ched du bsams shing btsal mi dgos par sngon gyi spyod pa'i shugs dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa yan chad ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba thams cad ched du bsams shing btsal mi dgos par sngon gyi spyod pa'i shugs dang /
translated: From the eighth bodhisattva ground on, all the activities of bringing sentient beings to full maturity and purifying a buddha realm are accomplished spontaneously and without the need for deliberate effort or search.

original: smon lam gyi mthus lhun gyis grub pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: smon lam gyi mthus lhun gyis grub pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They are completed by the power of previous conduct and the force of aspirations.

original: chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pas chos zab mos mi 'jigs shing mi skrag pa'i mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir chos zab mo'i bzod pa dam pa rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pas chos zab mos mi 'jigs shing mi skrag pa'i mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir chos zab mo'i bzod pa dam pa rtogs par khong du chud pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have realized that all phenomena are primordially unborn, they have attained the highest acceptance of the profound Dharma, which is the supreme state of fearlessness and non-apprehension with regard to the profound Dharma.

original: mi 'jig pa chen po thob pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos zab mo la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha'i 'khor dang / rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i 'khor dang / bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa'i 'khor gang dang gang du 'gro yang mi shes pas 'jigs shing bag tsha ba dang /
analyzed: mi 'jig pa chen po thob pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos zab mo la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha'i 'khor dang / rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i 'khor dang / bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa'i 'khor gang dang gang du 'gro yang mi shes pas 'jigs shing bag tsha ba dang /
translated: The line they attain great fearlessness means that because those bodhisattvas have attained acceptance of the profound Dharma, they go to any assembly of gods such as Brahma, any assembly of royalty or Brahmins, any assembly of demons, non Buddhists, and so on, without fear or apprehension because they are not known.

original: nyon mongs pa las gyur pa'i 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa chen po thob pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las gyur pa'i 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa chen po thob pa zhes bya'o//
translated: Because they are free of fear and apprehension arising from defilements, they are said to attain great fearlessness.

original: yid yongs su zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi 'jigs pa chen po thob pas rgyal rigs dang bram ze la sogs pa'i 'khor gang dang gang du 'gro yang 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med de /
analyzed: yid yongs su zhum pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar mi 'jigs pa chen po thob pas rgyal rigs dang bram ze la sogs pa'i 'khor gang dang gang du 'gro yang 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med de /
translated: The line their minds are never timid means that because they have attained great fearlessness, they go to any assembly of royalty, Brahmins, and so on, without fear or apprehension.

original: spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yid yongs su zhum pa med pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yid yongs su zhum pa med pa zhes bya'o//
translated: Because they are endowed with perfect eloquence, they are said to have minds that are never timid.

original: @10b bdud kyi las thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya bas ni cis kyang mi brdzi ba'i mthu dang ldan pa bstan te /
analyzed: @10b bdud kyi las thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya bas ni cis kyang mi brdzi ba'i mthu dang ldan pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase perfectly transcending all the activities of Mara indicates that he possesses the power of being invincible by anything.

original: bdud kyi las 'og nas 'byung ba rnams dang / mdo gzhan las bshad pa'i bdud kyi las thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: bdud kyi las 'og nas 'byung ba rnams dang / mdo gzhan las bshad pa'i bdud kyi las thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It means that he is not subject to any of the activities of Mara that will be explained below, or to any of the activities of Mara that are explained in other sutras.

original: las kyi sgrib pa rgyun bcad pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas mi shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa med cing /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa rgyun bcad pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas mi shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa med cing /
translated: The phrase having cut the continuity of karmic action means that, in the manner explained above, he is without the fear of ignorance and the mental afflictions.

original: bdud kyi las las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gror skye bar 'gyur ba med pa sha stag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdud kyi las las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gror skye bar 'gyur ba med pa sha stag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that, because he has perfectly transcended the activities of Mara, he is not reborn in the happy or the lower realms due to the power of his past actions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir rgol ba rab tu bcom pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir rgol ba rab tu bcom pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase having conquered the adversary means that he has eliminated the enemies of karmic action and the mental afflictions.

original: pha rol po'i rgol ba thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can phas rgol ba rnams kyis mi thub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol po'i rgol ba thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can phas rgol ba rnams kyis mi thub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase not overcome by any opponent means that he is not defeated by any non-Buddhist opponent.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya bas ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi shes pa dang / bsam pa dang / spyod yul rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes par mi nus pa zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya bas ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi shes pa dang / bsam pa dang / spyod yul rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes par mi nus pa zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase difficult to be fathomed by any ≈õrƒÅvaka or pratyekabuddha indicates that the knowledge, thought, and sphere of activity of those bodhisattvas cannot be known by ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: chos rab tu rtogs pas rnam par dbye zhing bstan pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams rab tu rtogs pas /
analyzed: chos rab tu rtogs pas rnam par dbye zhing bstan pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams rab tu rtogs pas /
translated: The phrase skilled in teaching through the discrimination of the full understanding of dharmas indicates that, through the full understanding of mundane dharmas such as the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc., and supramundane dharmas such as the stages, perfections, factors of enlightenment, etc., he is skilled in teaching through the discrimination of those dharmas.

original: chos de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / phyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par dbye zhing /
analyzed: chos de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / phyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par dbye zhing /
translated: It means that they are skilled in distinguishing the intrinsic characteristics of those phenomena and the characteristics of their external appearance,

original: gzhan la ston pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gzhan la ston pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: and in teaching them to others.

original: de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: Those explain the qualities of the bodhisattvas on the eighth level.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa nas smon lam shin tu brtsams pa zhes bya bas ni sa dgu pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa nas smon lam shin tu brtsams pa zhes bya bas ni sa dgu pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: From the phrase ‚Äúhaving begun aspirations for countless eons,‚Äù the qualities of the bodhisattvas on the ninth level are explained.

original: sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon bskal pa grangs med pa nas /
analyzed: sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon bskal pa grangs med pa nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the ninth level have previously made aspirations for countless eons

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / @11a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / @11a * //
translated: to perfect the qualities of the buddhas

original: sems can gyi don mthar phyin par bya bar smon lam btab cing /
analyzed: sems can gyi don mthar phyin par bya bar smon lam btab cing /
translated: and to bring sentient beings to the ultimate goal.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brtsams pa rnams mthar phyin cing yongs su rdzogs par gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brtsams pa rnams mthar phyin cing yongs su rdzogs par gyur te /
translated: They have completed and perfected the bodhisattva deeds that they began.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthu dang / spyod pa'i shugs kyis de yan chad sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i spyod pa dang / sems can gyi don yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i spyod pa rnams 'bad cing btsal mi dgos par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas su bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthu dang / spyod pa'i shugs kyis de yan chad sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i spyod pa dang / sems can gyi don yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i spyod pa rnams 'bad cing btsal mi dgos par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas su bsgrub pa dang /
translated: And from the power of their past aspirations and the force of their conduct, all the conduct that is required to complete the buddhas‚Äô teachings and all the conduct that is required to complete the benefit of sentient beings is accomplished spontaneously without effort or search.

original: sems can gyi don du spyod pa rnams kyang gdon mi za bar 'grub pas spyod pa nges pa la zhugs pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du spyod pa rnams kyang gdon mi za bar 'grub pas spyod pa nges pa la zhugs pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: And because they definitely engage in conduct that is certain to be accomplished, they are also called those who have entered the certainty of conduct.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par gyur pa yang sngon yun ring po nas smon lam shin tu brtsams pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par gyur pa yang sngon yun ring po nas smon lam shin tu brtsams pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And the fact that they have such qualities is the result of their having made aspirations for a very long time in the past.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa nas smon lam shin tu brtsams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa nas smon lam shin tu brtsams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: So they are called those who have made aspirations for countless kalpas.

original: bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa /
translated: They have a smiling face.

original: thog mar smra ba /
analyzed: thog mar smra ba /
translated: They speak first.

original: khro gnyer med pa zhes bya bas ni de ltar sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus spyod pa la nges par zhugs pas /
analyzed: khro gnyer med pa zhes bya bas ni de ltar sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus spyod pa la nges par zhugs pas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout a frown‚Äù indicates that, by the power of his previous aspirations, he is definitely engaged in the bodhisattva deeds.

original: sa dgu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag sngon sems can rnams la tshad med pa bzhi spyod spyod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sa dgu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag sngon sems can rnams la tshad med pa bzhi spyod spyod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe bodhisattvas on the ninth level‚Äù indicates the result that is the natural outcome of the four boundless attitudes that those bodhisattvas have practiced in the past.

original: de la bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni byams pa'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la bzhin 'dzum pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni byams pa'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith a smiling face‚Äù indicates the natural outcome of love.

original: sngon sems can la byams pa spyod spyod pa'i rgyus dus thams cad du sems can rnams la bzhin 'dzum pa 'ba' zhig ston cing sems can rnams dga' bar byed kyis /
analyzed: sngon sems can la byams pa spyod spyod pa'i rgyus dus thams cad du sems can rnams la bzhin 'dzum pa 'ba' zhig ston cing sems can rnams dga' bar byed kyis /
translated: Because of having practiced love toward sentient beings in the past, at all times he displays only a smiling face to sentient beings and delights them.

original: nam yang ngo 'dzum nag cing sems can rnams mi dga' bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam yang ngo 'dzum nag cing sems can rnams mi dga' bar mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He never frowns or makes sentient beings unhappy.

original: thog mar smra ba zhes bya bas ni snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thog mar smra ba zhes bya bas ni snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe first to speak‚Äù indicates the natural outcome of compassion.

original: sngon sems can rnams la snying rje spyod spyod pa'i rgyus byang chub sems dpa' de dag sems can glo bur du 'ongs pa ma 'dris pa rnams la yang snying rje'i shugs kyis sems can de dag dga' bar bya ba'i gtam gyis snga nas bsu zhing gsang por smra
analyzed: sngon sems can rnams la snying rje spyod spyod pa'i rgyus byang chub sems dpa' de dag sems can glo bur du 'ongs pa ma 'dris pa rnams la yang snying rje'i shugs kyis sems can de dag dga' bar bya ba'i gtam gyis snga nas bsu zhing gsang por smra
translated: Because in the past they practiced compassion for sentient beings, those bodhisattvas, through the force of compassion, greet and speak frankly to those sentient beings who are newly come and unknown to them with a conversation that delights them.

original: ba dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ba dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: khro gnyer med pa zhes bya bas ni dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mthun pa @11b bstan pa ste /
analyzed: khro gnyer med pa zhes bya bas ni dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mthun pa @11b bstan pa ste /
translated: The absence of frowns indicates the cause and result of joy and equanimity.

original: sngon sems can rnams kyi 'byor pa la phrag dog dang / sems 'khrugs pa med cing /
analyzed: sngon sems can rnams kyi 'byor pa la phrag dog dang / sems 'khrugs pa med cing /
translated: In the past they were not jealous of the wealth of sentient beings, their minds were not disturbed,üîΩand they generated joy again and again.

original: dga' ba bskyed bskyed pa dang / bdag la gnod pa byed pa dang / nyes pa byung ba rnams la yang bzod cing dang du blangs te /
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed bskyed pa dang / bdag la gnod pa byed pa dang / nyes pa byung ba rnams la yang bzod cing dang du blangs te /
translated: They were patient and tolerant of those who harmed them and of the faults that arose.

original: btang snyoms su 'jog 'jog pa'i rgyus mi dga' ba dang khros shing 'khrugs pa'i mtshan ma bzhin khro gnyer can du nam yang mi 'gyur ba dag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btang snyoms su 'jog 'jog pa'i rgyus mi dga' ba dang khros shing 'khrugs pa'i mtshan ma bzhin khro gnyer can du nam yang mi 'gyur ba dag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are never frowning, because of the cause of their remaining in equanimity, which is the opposite of the signs of displeasure and anger.

original: snyan cing 'jam pa'i tshig dang ldan pas pha rol la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs su brjod pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro 'gro ba dang / mngon par shes pa la spyod spyod pa rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: snyan cing 'jam pa'i tshig dang ldan pas pha rol la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs su brjod pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro 'gro ba dang / mngon par shes pa la spyod spyod pa rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bstan pa ste /
translated: They are skilled in the melodious expressions of verse, because of their possession of gentle and pleasant speech. This shows the qualities that are the natural outcome of their going from buddhafield to buddhafield and their practice of the higher knowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag sngon sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag sngon sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing /
translated: Those bodhisattvas go from buddhafield to buddhafield

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yon tan rnams brjod cing bstod bstod pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i mthus sems can rnams kyi spyod pa dang / bsam pa'i rjes su mthun par yid du 'ong zhing 'thad pa'i tshig gis chos ston ston pa'i rgyus sa dgu pa thob pa'i tshe yang lhun gyis grub pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bstod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yon tan rnams brjod cing bstod bstod pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i mthus sems can rnams kyi spyod pa dang / bsam pa'i rjes su mthun par yid du 'ong zhing 'thad pa'i tshig gis chos ston ston pa'i rgyus sa dgu pa thob pa'i tshe yang lhun gyis grub pa nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bstod pa dang /
translated: When they attain the ninth bhumi, they spontaneously praise the tathagatas and

original: sems can rnams la chos ston pa'i tshe snyan cing 'jam pa'i tshig dang ldan pa tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs su brjod pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston pa'i tshe snyan cing 'jam pa'i tshig dang ldan pa tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs su brjod pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: when they teach the Dharma to sentient beings, they are skilled in using melodious verses that are pleasing and gentle.

original: spobs pa mi chod pa zhes bya bas ni sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'khor gyi nang du chos smra ba chen po yin pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: spobs pa mi chod pa zhes bya bas ni sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'khor gyi nang du chos smra ba chen po yin pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: Unimpeded eloquence indicates the qualities of bodhisattvas dwelling on the ninth bhumi as great Dharma teachers in the midst of an assembly.

original: de dag so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan pas 'khor mang po la chos ston pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: de dag so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan pas 'khor mang po la chos ston pa'i tshe na /
translated: Since they possess the four detailed and thorough knowledges, when they teach the Dharma to a great retinue,

original: spobs pa chen pos bshad pa la thags thogs med cing sus kyang zil gyis mi gnon pa dang ldan pa dag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spobs pa chen pos bshad pa la thags thogs med cing sus kyang zil gyis mi gnon pa dang ldan pa dag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they have great eloquence and are unimpeded in their explanations, and no one can overpower them.üîΩThey have the fearlessness of overpowering limitless retinues.

original: 'khor mtha' yas pa zil gyis gnon pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni 'khor gyi nang du 'gro ba la mkhas pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor mtha' yas pa zil gyis gnon pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni 'khor gyi nang du 'gro ba la mkhas pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that they have the good qualities of skill in going to the retinue.

original: de ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan zhing spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa @12a * //
analyzed: de ltar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan zhing spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa @12a * //
translated: Thus, since they possess the four detailed and thorough knowledges and have perfect eloquence,

original: dang ldan pas lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'khor gang gi nang du 'gro na yang /
analyzed: dang ldan pas lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'khor gang gi nang du 'gro na yang /
translated: when they go to any retinue of gods, humans, and so on,

original: mi shes pas 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med de /
analyzed: mi shes pas 'jigs shing bag tsha ba med de /
translated: they are fearless and free of anxiety about their own lack of knowledge.

original: bdag gi shes pas ni 'khor thams cad zil gyis gnon la /
analyzed: bdag gi shes pas ni 'khor thams cad zil gyis gnon la /
translated: Their own knowledge overpowers the entire retinue.

original: gzhan sus kyang bdag zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir 'khor mtha' yas pa zil gyis gnon pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan sus kyang bdag zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir 'khor mtha' yas pa zil gyis gnon pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is said to have the fearlessness of overwhelming an infinite retinue, because no one can overwhelm him.

original: bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas par bstan pa'i ye shes kyi 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas par bstan pa'i ye shes kyi 'byung ba la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa bstan pa ste /
translated: He is said to be skilled in the emergence of the wisdom that teaches for infinite millions of eons, because he has the result that is in harmony with the perfection of effort.

original: sems can gyi don du chos ston pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa'i brtson 'grus lhun gyis grub pas ci bya'o cog la skyo zhing yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du chos ston pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa'i brtson 'grus lhun gyis grub pas ci bya'o cog la skyo zhing yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: He is never discouraged or disheartened by anything he has to do, because he spontaneously teaches the Dharma and makes efforts to help sentient beings, even in difficult situations.

original: bskal pa du mar spyod kyang yun ring por thogs pa'i 'du shes med pas /üîΩbskal pa bye ba mtha' yas pa yang yengs la zad cing 'das pa'am /
analyzed: bskal pa du mar spyod kyang yun ring por thogs pa'i 'du shes med pas / bskal pa bye ba mtha' yas pa yang yengs la zad cing 'das pa'am /
translated: Even though he practices for many eons, he does not have the idea that it is taking a long time.üîΩHe is skilled in making infinite millions of eons pass quickly,

original: de las byung bar byed pa la mkhas pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung bar byed pa la mkhas pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: or in making them last longer than that.

original: de ltar sa dgu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la nges par zhugs pa rnams kyi yon tan bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sa dgu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la nges par zhugs pa rnams kyi yon tan bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the qualities of the bodhisattvas on the ninth level who have set out on the path,

original: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig gis thogs pa rnams kyi yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the qualities of the bodhisattvas on the tenth level who are impeded by a single birth,

original: thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / nam mkha' dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur khong du chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / nam mkha' dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / sprul pa dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur khong du chud pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThey have realized that everything is like an illusion, a mirage, a reflection of the moon in water, a dream, an echo, an optical illusion, space, a fairy city, a magical creation, and a reflection.‚Äù

original: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs kyang /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs kyang /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the tenth level have realized that ultimately all phenomena are devoid of substantial existence.

original: kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod cing bkur stir bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang rnam par grol bar bya ba'i spyod pa rnams sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthu dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod cing bkur stir bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang rnam par grol bar bya ba'i spyod pa rnams sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthu dang /
translated: On the relative level, they make offerings to the tathagatas and honor them, they purify the buddhafields and they engage in conduct to bring sentient beings to full maturity and to liberation.üîΩ

original: spyod pa'i shugs kyis btsal zhing 'bad mi dgos par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ste /
analyzed: spyod pa'i shugs kyis btsal zhing 'bad mi dgos par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du 'byung ste /
translated: On the relative level, the deeds of making offerings to the tathagatas, honoring them, purifying a buddha field, and bringing sentient beings to full maturity and liberation all occur spontaneously, without the need for any effort or search on the part of the bodhisattvas, due to the power of their previous aspirations and the momentum of their conduct.

original: spyod pa de dag la yang dngos po dang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing ma chags par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: spyod pa de dag la yang dngos po dang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing ma chags par spyod pa ni /
translated: And in all these deeds, they do not cling to things and attributes, but rather engage in them without attachment.

original: chos @12b thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa lta bur khong du chud pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos @12b thams cad sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa lta bur khong du chud pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This is because they have realized that all phenomena are like illusions, mirages, and so forth.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe rnam pa bcu bstan pa yang /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe rnam pa bcu bstan pa yang /
translated: The ten examples of illusions and so forth are taught

original: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi bsam pa dang / the tshom tha dad pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi bsam pa dang / the tshom tha dad pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: in order to dispel the different doubts and thoughts of beings to be tamed.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: All phenomena are empty by nature.

original: dngos po med na ci'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: dngos po med na ci'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If they are not real things, why do they appear in various aspects such as color and shape?

original: sgyu ma'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe bstan te /
translated: The example of an illusion is taught in response to that thought.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis rta dang glang po che la sogs pa'i dngos po sna tshogs byas pa rnams kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i khyad par sna tshogs su snang yang yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis rta dang glang po che la sogs pa'i dngos po sna tshogs byas pa rnams kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i khyad par sna tshogs su snang yang yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, although various things such as horses and elephants created by a magician appear to have various distinctions such as color and shape, they are not real.

original: chos thams cad kyang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i dngos por snang yang yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i dngos por snang yang yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, although all phenomena appear as things such as color and shape, they are not real.

original: sems can kha cig ni de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med na /
analyzed: sems can kha cig ni de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med na /
translated: Some sentient beings think, ‚ÄúIf all phenomena are not real things,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ci la yang dmigs te 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ci la yang dmigs te 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: on what do the mind and mental factors focus and arise?‚Äù

original: smig rgyu'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: smig rgyu'i dpe bstan te /
translated: The example of a mirage is taught in response to that thought.

original: smig rgyu la chu'i dngos po med par yang de la dmigs nas chu'i 'du shes skye zhing /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu'i dngos po med par yang de la dmigs nas chu'i 'du shes skye zhing /
translated: Although there is no water in a mirage, when one focuses on it, the idea of water arises,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: and the mind and mental factors occur.

original: chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin dngos po med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin dngos po med de /
translated: In the same way, all phenomena are devoid of any real, substantial nature.

original: dmigs pa'i yul ma yin yang /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul ma yin yang /
translated: They are not objects that can be observed.

original: sems can rnams phyin ci log tu rtog cing 'khrugs pa las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sems can rnams phyin ci log tu rtog cing 'khrugs pa las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: However, the mind and mental factors occur due to sentient beings‚Äô mistaken thoughts and confusion.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med na skye ba dang 'jig par yang ji ltar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la chu zla'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med na skye ba dang 'jig par yang ji ltar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la chu zla'i dpe bstan te /
translated: If all phenomena are devoid of any real substance, how can they arise and cease? The example of the moon‚Äôs reflection in water is taught to address this question.

original: dper na nam mkha' la zla ba snang na ni chu'i nang du yang zla ba 'byung zhing snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la zla ba snang na ni chu'i nang du yang zla ba 'byung zhing snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: For example, when the moon appears in the sky, the moon also appears and arises in the water.

original: nam mkha' la zla ba mi snang na ni chu'i nang gi zla ba yang med cing mi snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: nam mkha' la zla ba mi snang na ni chu'i nang gi zla ba yang med cing mi snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: When the moon does not appear in the sky, the moon in the water also disappears.

original: chos thams cad skye ba dang 'jig par snang ba yang phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i bag chags yod na ni snang la bag chags de dag byang ste med na skye ba dang 'jig par yang mi snang ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba dang 'jig par snang ba yang phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i bag chags yod na ni snang la bag chags de dag byang ste med na skye ba dang 'jig par yang mi snang ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that if there is a habitual tendency to conceive of things as arising and ceasing in an erroneous way, then things will appear to arise and cease. But if those habitual tendencies are purified and no longer exist, then things will not appear to arise and cease.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis @13a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis @13a * //
translated: All phenomena are empty by nature.

original: stong ste dngos po med na /
analyzed: stong ste dngos po med na /
translated: If they are not real,

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnams ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnams ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: how can worldly conventions such as eating, drinking, and so on, occur?

original: rmi lam gyi dpe bstan te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dpe bstan te /
translated: The example of a dream is taught in response to this.

original: dper na rmi lam na bza' ba dang btung ba dang / sbyin pa dang len pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs par snang yang dngos po'i rang bzhin du yong  pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam na bza' ba dang btung ba dang / sbyin pa dang len pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs par snang yang dngos po'i rang bzhin du yong  pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, in a dream, eating, drinking, giving, receiving, happiness, suffering, and so on appear in various ways, but they are not real by nature.

original: chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med par yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba'i rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med par yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba'i rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are ultimately unreal, like a dream in which various worldly conventions appear.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med na ming gi cho ga tshogs dang tshig gi tshigs rnams ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med na ming gi cho ga tshogs dang tshig gi tshigs rnams ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If all phenomena are unreal, how can the collection of names and the collection of words arise?

original: sgra brnyan gyi dpe bstan te /
analyzed: sgra brnyan gyi dpe bstan te /
translated: The example of an echo is taught for this.

original: dper na brag dang / gcong rong smra ba med pa las sgra 'byung ba grag pa /
analyzed: dper na brag dang / gcong rong smra ba med pa las sgra 'byung ba grag pa /
translated: For example, from a rock or a canyon, which are not speaking, a sound arises that is heard.

original: sgra gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sgra gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: It arises due to the condition of another sound.

original: sgrar rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa las /
analyzed: sgrar rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa 'khrul pa las /
translated: In the same way, from the confusion of the consciousness that conceives of sound,

original: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs rnams 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs rnams 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: the collection of names and the collection of words arise.

original: dngos po ni gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But there is no real thing at all.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med na /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med na /
translated: If all phenomena are unreal,

original: ji ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: how can they arise from causes and conditions?

original: mig yor dang / nam mkha' dang / dri za'i grong khyer gyi dpe bstan te /
analyzed: mig yor dang / nam mkha' dang / dri za'i grong khyer gyi dpe bstan te /
translated: The examples of an optical illusion, the sky, and a fairy city are taught.

original: dper na mig rab rib can du gyur pa'i rgyus skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa snang ba dang / ri rab kyi ngos su rin po che bee d'urya'i 'od kyis nam mkha' sngon po sdang ba dang / yul gyi khyad par dang sprin dang nye ba'i rgyus /
analyzed: dper na mig rab rib can du gyur pa'i rgyus skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa snang ba dang / ri rab kyi ngos su rin po che bee d'urya'i 'od kyis nam mkha' sngon po sdang ba dang / yul gyi khyad par dang sprin dang nye ba'i rgyus /
translated: For example, due to the cause of having an eye disease, such things as a mass of hair appear, and due to the light of a sapphire on the side of Mount Meru, the sky appears blue, and due to the particular place, clouds, and proximity, a fairy city appears.

original: dri za'i grong khyer dngos su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba yang don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer dngos su yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba yang don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as those do not exist in reality, so also all phenomena, which arise from causes and conditions, do not exist in reality.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med na /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med na /
translated: If all phenomena are unreal,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dra bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dra bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: how can cause and effect be similar?

original: gzugs brnyan gyi dpe bstan te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi dpe bstan te /
translated: The example of a reflection is taught.

original: bzhin gyi rgyus me long gi nang du bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan bzhin dang 'dra bar snang yang /
analyzed: bzhin gyi rgyus me long gi nang du bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan bzhin dang 'dra bar snang yang /
translated: The reflection of a face appears in a mirror in a way that is similar to the face due to the cause of the face.

original: bzhin yang dag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dra bar 'byung yang don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin yang dag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dra bar 'byung yang don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, although causes and effects arise in a similar way, ultimately, all phenomena do not exist.

original: chos thams @13b cad dngos po med na /
analyzed: chos thams @13b cad dngos po med na /
translated: If all phenomena are unreal,

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams ji ltar yod par 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams ji ltar yod par 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: how can the activities of coming and going and so forth exist?

original: sprul pa'i dpe bstan te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i dpe bstan te /
translated: The example of emanations is taught in response to this thought.

original: dper na sprul pa rnams 'gro ba dang 'od pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las rnams byed pa sna tshogs snang yang /
analyzed: dper na sprul pa rnams 'gro ba dang 'od pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las rnams byed pa sna tshogs snang yang /
translated: For example, although the various activities of the body, such as coming and going, and the various activities of speech of emanations appear,

original: dngos por yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dngos por yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: they do not exist as things.

original: chos thams cad kyang kun rdzob tu bya ba sna tshogs byed par snang yang don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang kun rdzob tu bya ba sna tshogs byed par snang yang don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, although the various activities of all phenomena appear to be performed conventionally, ultimately, things do not exist.

original: sems yongs su zhum pa med pa zhes bya bas ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems shin tu rnam par dag pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems yongs su zhum pa med pa zhes bya bas ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems shin tu rnam par dag pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äútheir minds are utterly without discouragement‚Äù teaches the quality of the bodhisattvas‚Äô extremely pure minds.

original: sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig ni tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kha cig ni tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: Some bodhisattvas who are on the lower stages have not completed the collections of merit and wisdom and have conceptual thoughts.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan gyis 'phags pa rnams kyi spyan sngar sems zhum par 'gyur yang srid kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan gyis 'phags pa rnams kyi spyan sngar sems zhum par 'gyur yang srid kyi /
translated: It is possible that in the presence of the tathƒÅgatas and of the bodhisattvas who are on the lower stages and who are superior in terms of their good qualities, their minds may become discouraged.

original: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing /
translated: But the bodhisattvas who are on the tenth stage have completed the collections of merit and wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyi sa grub pa dang / dbang po rnams thob pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du sems zhum pa med pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyi sa grub pa dang / dbang po rnams thob pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du sems zhum pa med pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They have attained the effortless, nonconceptual gnosis and the powers. Therefore, in every respect, their minds are utterly without discouragement.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu ba dang / shes pa phra ba dang / spyod pa dang / mos pa khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyus sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu ba dang / shes pa phra ba dang / spyod pa dang / mos pa khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyus sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: The line ‚Äúskill in understanding the mental activity, subtle knowledge, conduct, and interests of all sentient beings‚Äù indicates that through the cause of perfecting the perfection of wisdom, he has attained the meditative absorption known as ‚Äúrealizing the mental activity of all sentient beings‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas /
translated: and the meditative absorption known as ‚Äúentering the realm of phenomena.‚Äù

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu ba dang / mos pa khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes phra ba dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu ba dang / mos pa khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes phra ba dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas pa'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: Through these, he has the qualities of understanding the mental activity and interests of all sentient beings and of being skilled in understanding the subtle knowledge and conduct of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: de la sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu ba dang / mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs khong du chud @14a * //
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas ni sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyu ba dang / mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs khong du chud @14a * //
translated: By attaining the samadhi called ‚Äúrealizing the mental activity of all sentient beings,‚Äù he understood the mental activity of all sentient beings and their various inclinations.

original: nas sems can de dag gdul ba'i thabs la mkhas par gyur to //
analyzed: nas sems can de dag gdul ba'i thabs la mkhas par gyur to //
translated: Thus he became skilled in the means of training those sentient beings.

original: chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes zab cing phra ba dang / spyod pa rgya chen po khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas par gyur pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes zab cing phra ba dang / spyod pa rgya chen po khong du chud par bya ba la mkhas par gyur pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: By attaining the samadhi called ‚Äúentering the dharmadhatu,‚Äù he became skilled in understanding the profound and subtle wisdom and vast conduct of the tathagatas.

original: sems can thams cad la sdang ba med pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la brtson 'grus ma btang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sdang ba med pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la brtson 'grus ma btang ba'i phyir /
translated: By saying ‚Äúhaving a mind free from hostility towards any sentient being,‚Äù it shows that he never gave up his effort to protect all sentient beings.

original: byams pa chen po'i stobs dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'i stobs dang ldan pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i stobs dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'i stobs dang ldan pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The power of great love and the power of great compassion in order to eliminate the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: bzod pa rlabs chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i de dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes khyad par can du dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas /
analyzed: bzod pa rlabs chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i de dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes khyad par can du dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas /
translated: Those who have attained the acceptance of the non-arising of all phenomena, who have attained the samadhi of empowerment into the special wisdom of omniscience while abiding on the ten grounds,

original: sa 'og ma dag la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa de dag shin tu sbyangs shing rgya che bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa 'og ma dag la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa de dag shin tu sbyangs shing rgya che bar 'gyur te /
translated: they become very relaxed and vast.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul zab cing phra ba rtogs par dka' ba rnams kyang rtogs par nus shing bzod pa rlabs chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi spyod yul zab cing phra ba rtogs par dka' ba rnams kyang rtogs par nus shing bzod pa rlabs chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They are able to realize the profound and subtle objects of knowledge of the Bhagavan Buddha and are called those who have attained the great acceptance.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mkhyen pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa la dar las chod pa tsam mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mkhyen pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa la dar las chod pa tsam mo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of those bodhisattvas is said to be only a fraction of omniscience.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba'i ye shes la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba'i ye shes la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
translated: Skill in the wisdom that realizes the sameness of all phenomena refers to the suchness that is the reality of the sameness of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid de dag gis so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par byed pa la yang mkhas la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de dag gis so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par byed pa la yang mkhas la /
translated: They are skilled in realizing that suchness by the wisdom of individually cognizing it for themselves,

original: gzhan rtogs par byed du 'jug pa la yang mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs par byed du 'jug pa la yang mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and they are also skilled in causing others to realize it. This is the meaning.

original: chos nyid zab mo dang ldan pas gting dpag dka' ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis chos nyid zab mo rtogs pas de dag gi sems kyang zab cing brtag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid zab mo dang ldan pas gting dpag dka' ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis chos nyid zab mo rtogs pas de dag gi sems kyang zab cing brtag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Difficult to fathom because of possessing profound reality refers to the fact that the minds of those bodhisattvas are profound and difficult to fathom because they realize profound reality.

original: rang gi sems la dbang rab tu thob pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems yongs su dag pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi sems la dbang rab tu thob pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems yongs su dag pas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey have attained mastery over their own minds‚Äù means that their minds are completely pure, so they are not subject to the mental afflictions.

original: chos thams cad la dbang @14b shin tu thob pa zhes bya bas ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad sems tsam du zad par shes pas phyi rol gyi dngos po mi brtson bar /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang @14b shin tu thob pa zhes bya bas ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad sems tsam du zad par shes pas phyi rol gyi dngos po mi brtson bar /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey have attained mastery over all phenomena‚Äù means that they know that all phenomena, both those that are conditioned and those that are unconditioned, are nothing but mind.

original: bdag gi sems kyis ci 'dod par bsgyur nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sems kyis ci 'dod par bsgyur nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, they are able to transform their minds into whatever they wish, and they possess the power to do so.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i dbang gis khams gsum du mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i dbang gis khams gsum du mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are liberated from all the obscurations of karma, the mental afflictions, and the views‚Äù means that they are not reborn in the three realms due to the power of karma, the mental afflictions, and the views.

original: bden pa rtogs par bstan pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa la mkhas pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa rtogs par bstan pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bas ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa la mkhas pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase skilled in teaching the realization of the truths indicates that they are skilled in teaching the twelve factors of dependent origination in order to help others realize them.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshul zad mi shes pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ba la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos zab mo la bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshul zad mi shes pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ba la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i chos zab mo la bya'o //
translated: The phrase engaged in the inexhaustible way of dependent origination indicates that the way of dependent origination refers to the profound teaching of the non-arising and non-ceasing of phenomena.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa nyid la zad mi shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa nyid la zad mi shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase inexhaustible refers to the non-arising and non-ceasing of phenomena.

original: de la zhugs pa ni rtogs shing khong du chud pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa ni rtogs shing khong du chud pa la bya'o //
translated: Those who are engaged in this teaching are those who have realized and understood it.

original: lta ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang ba thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lta ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas ldang ba thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase free from all views, latent tendencies, and afflictive emotions indicates that they are free from the afflictive emotions that are abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lta ba ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang ; lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang ; lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The views are the view of the perishable composite, the extreme views, the false views, the holding as paramount of views, and the holding as paramount of morality and asceticism.

original: bag la nyal ba ni bdun te /üîΩ'dod pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal ba dang / khong khro ba bag la nyal ba dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal ba dang / nga rgyal bag la nyal ba dang / ma rig pa bag la nyal ba dang / lta ba bag la nyal ba dang /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba ni bdun te / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal ba dang / khong khro ba bag la nyal ba dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal ba dang / nga rgyal bag la nyal ba dang / ma rig pa bag la nyal ba dang / lta ba bag la nyal ba dang /
translated: The latent proclivities are seven:

original: the tshom bag la nyal ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom bag la nyal ba'o //
translated: the latent proclivity of desire for sense-pleasures, the latent proclivity of repugnance, the latent proclivity of desire for existence, the latent proclivity of pride, the latent proclivity of ignorance, the latent proclivity of views, and the latent proclivity of scepticism.

original: kun nas ldang ba brgyad de /
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba brgyad de /
translated: The envelopments are eight:

original: rmugs pa kun nas ldang ba dang / gnyid kun nas ldang ba dang / rgod pa kun nas ldang ba dang / the tshom kun nas ldang ba dang ; phrag dog kun nas ldang ba dang / ser sna kun nas ldang ba dang / khrel med pa kun nas ldang ba dang /
analyzed: rmugs pa kun nas ldang ba dang / gnyid kun nas ldang ba dang / rgod pa kun nas ldang ba dang / the tshom kun nas ldang ba dang ; phrag dog kun nas ldang ba dang / ser sna kun nas ldang ba dang / khrel med pa kun nas ldang ba dang /
translated: the latent tendencies of stinginess,

original: ngo tsha mi shes pa kun nas ldang ba ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha mi shes pa kun nas ldang ba ste /
translated: the latent tendencies of shamelessness,üîΩand the latent tendencies of lack of embarrassment.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of free from those afflictions is as follows.

original: kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba la /üîΩkun tu @15a * //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba la / kun tu @15a * //
translated: Abandoning all fetters means

original: sbyor ba ni dgu ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni dgu ste /
translated: the following nine fetters:üîΩThe fetter of attachment,üîΩthe fetter of anger,üîΩthe fetter of pride,üîΩthe fetter of ignorance,üîΩthe fetter of views,

original: chags pa kun du sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba kun du sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal kun du sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba kun du sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa kun du sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: chags pa kun du sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba kun du sbyor ba dang / nga rgyal kun du sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba kun du sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa kun du sbyor ba dang /
translated: the fetter of grasping extremes,

original: the tshom kun du sbyor ba dang / phrag dog kun du sbyor ba dang / ser sna kun du sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: the tshom kun du sbyor ba dang / phrag dog kun du sbyor ba dang / ser sna kun du sbyor ba ste /
translated: The fetter of doubt, the fetter of envy, and the fetter of avarice.

original: nyon mongs pa 'di rnams sems can rnams 'gro ba rgyud lngar skye bar byed cing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di rnams sems can rnams 'gro ba rgyud lngar skye bar byed cing /
translated: These afflictions cause sentient beings to be born in the five destinies.

original: kun tu sbyor ba'i phyir kun tu sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba'i phyir kun tu sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they bind, they are called fetters.

original: nyon mongs pa de rnams spangs pa la kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de rnams spangs pa la kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of those afflictions is called the abandonment of all fetters.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Skill in the pacification of all karma and afflictions means

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad la bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa dag go zhes bstan pa'o //

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba shin tu yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba shin tu yongs su dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Therefore, one should strive in this perfection of wisdom. This means that one should strive in the perfection of wisdom which is completely pure and free from all conceptualization.

original: to // kha cig na re 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni @26b theg pa chen po la bya bas na nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: to // kha cig na re 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni @26b theg pa chen po la bya bas na nyan thos kyi theg pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa spangs pa ste /
translated: Some say that here the perfection of wisdom is called the Mahayana, so it is the abandonment of the Sravakayana and the Pratyekabuddhayana.

original: theg pa chen po la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: The meaning is that one should strive in the Mahayana.

original: kha cig na re de la gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba rnam
analyzed: kha cig na re de la gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba rnam
translated: Some say: When the perfection of wisdom is the state of omniscience, then one should strive in the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means one should strive for the sake of omniscience.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab bam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab bam /
translated: When nonconceptual wisdom

original: theg pa chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas te brtson par bya'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnas te brtson par bya'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: or the Mahayana becomes the perfection of wisdom, then one should be aware that one should abide in that perfection of wisdom and strive.
