original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba la brtson pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba la brtson pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Strive in the perfection of wisdom has three types of striving.

original: bslab pa la brtson pa dang / spyod pa la brtson pa dang / yang dag par sgrub pa la brtson ba'o //üîΩde la mnyan ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa la brtson pa dang / spyod pa la brtson pa dang / yang dag par sgrub pa la brtson ba'o // de la mnyan ba'o //
translated: striving in the training, striving in practice, and striving in perfect realization.

original: bsam pa la sogs pa'i dus na ni bslab pa la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa la sogs pa'i dus na ni bslab pa la brtson pa ste /
translated: In the stage of listening, one strives in the training.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
translated: And that is explained below as ‚Äúone should train in the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa'i dus na ni spyad pa la brtson par bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus na ni spyad pa la brtson par bya ba ste /
translated: In the stage of practice, one strives in practice.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
translated: And that is explained below as ‚Äúone should practice the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i dus na ni yang dag par 'grub pa la brtson pa ste /üîΩde yang brtson par byed pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i dus na ni yang dag par 'grub pa la brtson pa ste / de yang brtson par byed pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: In the stage of full realization, one strives in perfect realization.

original: zhes 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
translated: And that is explained below as ‚Äúone should strive.‚Äù

original: brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bya bar 'os pa ste bya ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bya bar 'os pa ste bya ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should strive‚Äù means one should do what is appropriate, one should do what is fitting.

original: de dag gis ni gang gis bya ba dang / gang la bya ba dang / gang bya ba rnam pa de gsum bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni gang gis bya ba dang / gang la bya ba dang / gang bya ba rnam pa de gsum bstan pa yin te /
translated: These three verses indicate the one who acts, the one on whose behalf one acts, and the action itself.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams la ni nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams la ni nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no certainty for those of the Disciple and Solitary Sage Vehicles,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: the Bodhisattvas themselves act.

original: bsgrub par bya ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba de yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba de yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: Because it is the root of all accomplishments, the action is in the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: rgyun chad pa dang / gus pa dang / 'grub pa la sogs pas brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa dang / gus pa dang / 'grub pa la sogs pas brtson par bya'o //
translated: One should strive with uninterrupted, respectful, and accomplished practice.

original: 'dir 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa gsum bstan te /üîΩchos thams cad rnam pa @27a * //
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa gsum bstan te / chos thams cad rnam pa @27a * //
translated: Here, the perfection of result, the perfection of cause, and the perfection of application are taught.

original: thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: All dharmas in all aspects are fully and perfectly realized. This is the result.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the cause.

original: brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should strive‚Äù is the application.

original: rdo rje gcod pa las gnas par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rdo rje gcod pa las gnas par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is explained in the Diamond Cutter in terms of abiding, accomplishing, and thoroughly holding the mind,

original: 'dir yang chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs par bstan pas gnas pa san  pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs par bstan pas gnas pa san  pa yin no //
translated: here too, by saying ‚Äúone who wishes to fully and completely awaken to all aspects of all phenomena,‚Äù the perfection of intention is shown, which is the abiding.

original: brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should strive‚Äù shows the accomplishment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya bas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba'i phyir sems rab tu gzung bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes bya bas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba'i phyir sems rab tu gzung bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the perfection of wisdom‚Äù shows the thorough holding of the mind in order to strive in the nonconceptual perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar mgo smos pas go ba rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar mgo smos pas go ba rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Thus, for the sake of those who understand through a brief indication, after completing the perfection of wisdom,

original: bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar gyur pa dang / de'i 'og tu gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rnam par spros na go ba rnams kyi don du 'bring du bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das cang mi gsung bar gyur pa dang / de'i 'og tu gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rnam par spros na go ba rnams kyi don du 'bring du bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: The Lord remained silent, and then the elder Shariputra, in order to open up the section of the medium explanation for the sake of those who understand through elaboration,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal bas /
translated: said, ‚ÄúBhagavan, bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas who wish to fully and completely awaken to all phenomena in all aspectsüîΩshould exert themselves in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyi zhes bya ba'i zhu ba brtsams so //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyi zhes bya ba'i zhu ba brtsams so //
translated: ‚Äù Thus he began the request.

original: des ni mdor bstan pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni mdor bstan pa'i chos rnam pa bzhi zhus pa yin te /
translated: He asked about the four topics that were briefly indicated:

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva? How do they wish to fully and completely awaken to all phenomena in all aspects? What is the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar brtson par bgyi zhes bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: ji ltar brtson par bgyi zhes bya ba rnams te /
translated: How should one strive?

original: de bzhi yang 'og nas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: de bzhi yang 'og nas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du ston to //
translated: Those four are taught below in the appropriate contexts.üîΩTherein, O son of noble family, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, abiding in the perfection of wisdom by the method of non-abiding, should complete the perfection of generosity by the method of non-abandonment, because the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not observed.

original: de la shar dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnas pa med pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / yongs su len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su @27b gtang ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bshad pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad bsdus te bstan nas /
analyzed: de la shar dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnas pa med pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / yongs su len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su @27b gtang ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bshad pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad bsdus te bstan nas /
translated: Having taught in brief by this and so on, all phenomena are included and taught.

original: spyod pa rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: spyod pa rnam pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: The four types of conduct are taught.

original: spyod pa rnam pa bzhi yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa dang / bar du gcod pa med par sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i spyod pa dang /
analyzed: spyod pa rnam pa bzhi yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa dang / bar du gcod pa med par sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i spyod pa dang /
translated: The four kinds of conduct are the conduct of the transcendent perfections without concepts, the conduct of the factors for enlightenment without defilements, the conduct of bringing sentient beings to full maturity without any obstacles and the conduct of the great means of attracting disciples.üîΩ

original: gos pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gos pa med par sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of practice are the practice of the nondiscriminatory perfection, the practice of the factors of enlightenment without afflictions, the practice of bringing sentient beings to maturity without obstacles, and the practice of bringing all the qualities of the Buddha to maturity without contamination.

original: de la thabs mkhas pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la thabs mkhas pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo //
translated: Skill in means accomplishes the practice of the perfections.

original: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pas ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa 'grub bo //
translated: Knowledge of thorough acquaintance accomplishes the practice of the factors of enlightenment.

original: snying rjes ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: snying rjes ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo //
translated: Compassion accomplishes the practice of bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: shes rab kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa 'grub bo //
translated: Wisdom accomplishes the practice of bringing the qualities of the Buddha to maturity.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of the nondiscriminatory perfection is as follows:

original: gnas pa med pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: The phrase abiding in the perfection of wisdom in a manner free of any basis and so forth teaches this.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa de yang gnas pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa de yang gnas pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The practice of the perfections is taught through three topics: abiding, accomplishment, and the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: rdo rje gcod pa las gnas par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba bstan pa lta bu'o //üîΩde la gnas pa med pa'i tshul du /
analyzed: rdo rje gcod pa las gnas par bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba bstan pa lta bu'o // de la gnas pa med pa'i tshul du /
translated: This is similar to the teachings on abiding, accomplishment, and the thorough restraint of the mind in the Diamond Cutter Sutra.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúabiding in the perfection of wisdom in a manner free of any basis‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa yongs su btang ste /
translated: means that one has given up any desire for the special results that come from the perfections other than wisdom.

original: snying rje'i dbang gis sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba bsgrub par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis khams gsum pa'am chos thams cad kyang rung ste /
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba bsgrub par bya ba'i bsam pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis khams gsum pa'am chos thams cad kyang rung ste /
translated: Through the power of compassion, one has the intention to accomplish the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: gang la yang mi gnas pa ni 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la yang mi gnas pa ni 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not dwelling anywhere is called here dwelling in the perfection of wisdom.

original: thams cad la mi gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la mi gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The very non-dwelling in anything is dwelling in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dam /üîΩrnam par mi rtog pa'i @28a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dam / rnam par mi rtog pa'i @28a * //
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom is shown to be the knowledge of all aspects,

original: shes rab bam /
analyzed: shes rab bam /
translated: or non-conceptual wisdom,

original: theg pa chen po yin par bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yin par bstan to //
translated: or the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub kyi lam dang mthun par spyod pa ni sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam dang mthun par spyod pa ni sgrub pa ste /
translated: Practice is the conduct in accordance with the path to enlightenment.

original: de bas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of generosity should be completed.

original: don dam par chos thams cad la yongs su mi rtog pa ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad la yongs su mi rtog pa ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: The complete non-conceptuality regarding all phenomena in the ultimate sense is the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: de bas na sbyin par bya ba dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sbyin par bya ba dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúin the manner of not giving up, because the object given, the giver, and the recipient are not apprehended.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rjes bskyod pas sems can thams cad la ci 'dod pa de thams cad sbyin par byed kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni snying rjes bskyod pas sems can thams cad la ci 'dod pa de thams cad sbyin par byed kyang /
translated: The bodhisattva, moved by compassion, gives to all sentient beings whatever they want.

original: de'i tshe ni de sbyin pa zhes brjod par zad kyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de sbyin pa zhes brjod par zad kyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, it is called ‚Äúgenerosity,‚Äù but it is not the perfection of generosity.

original: gang gi tshe sbyin pa byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbyin pa byed pa'am /
translated: When the bodhisattva gives a gift,

original: sbyin pa byin pa'i 'og tu yongs su brtag pa bzhis yongs su brtags shing /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa'i 'og tu yongs su brtag pa bzhis yongs su brtags shing /
translated: or after giving a gift, by means of the four investigations,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes par byed pa bzhis yongs su shes par byas nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes par byed pa bzhis yongs su shes par byas nas /
translated: and having investigated with the four thorough knowledges of reality as it is,

original: shes rab kyis yongs su dag par byed pa de'i tshe na de legs par sbyangs pas pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis yongs su dag par byed pa de'i tshe na de legs par sbyangs pas pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and having purified it with wisdom, at that time it becomes what is called ‚Äúthe perfection of generosity‚Äù through being well trained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dang por snying rjes las thams cad byas nas phyis shes rab kyis yongs su sbyong ngo ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dang por snying rjes las thams cad byas nas phyis shes rab kyis yongs su sbyong ngo ;
translated: The bodhisattva first performs all deeds through compassion and later purifies them through wisdom.

original: / de bas na snying rjes ni sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: / de bas na snying rjes ni sgrub par byed do //
translated: Therefore, compassion is the cause of practice.

original: shes rab kyis ni dag par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni dag par byed do //
translated: Wisdom is the cause of purification.

original: snying rjes ni bsam pa dag par byed do //
analyzed: snying rjes ni bsam pa dag par byed do //
translated: Compassion purifies the intention.

original: shes rab kyis ni sbyor ba dag par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni sbyor ba dag par byed do //
translated: Wisdom purifies the application.

original: snying rjes ni kun rdzob la gnas te sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: snying rjes ni kun rdzob la gnas te sgrub par byed do //
translated: Compassion, based on the conventional, is the cause of practice.

original: shes rab kyis ni don dam pa la gnas te sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni don dam pa la gnas te sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Wisdom, based on the ultimate, is the cause of purification.

original: snying rjes ni las thams cad sems can gyi don du byas pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs su bgrang ngo //
analyzed: snying rjes ni las thams cad sems can gyi don du byas pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs su bgrang ngo //
translated: Compassion is counted as the accumulation of merit because all deeds are done for the sake of sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis ni byang chub kyi don gyi phyir byas pas ye shes kyi tshogs su bgrang ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni byang chub kyi don gyi phyir byas pas ye shes kyi tshogs su bgrang ngo //
translated: Wisdom is counted as the accumulation of knowledge because it is done for the sake of enlightenment.

original: de bas na yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of generosity should be completed by the method of not giving up.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa dang po la de bzhin nyid rtogs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa dang po la de bzhin nyid rtogs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, the bodhisattvas, beginning with the realization of suchness on the first ground,

original: sbyor ba thams cad don dam par brtags nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad don dam par brtags nas /
translated: examine all practices in terms of the ultimate.

original: de bzhin nyid du mngon sum du mthong bas /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du mngon sum du mthong bas /
translated: By directly seeing suchness,

original: de bzhin du @28b gnas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin nyid de yang sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe ni sus kyang sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du @28b gnas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // de bzhin nyid de yang sbyin pa byed pa'i tshe ni sus kyang sbyin pa'am /
translated: they abide in suchness, not otherwise.

original: blang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: blang bar mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, when generosity is practiced, no one is able to give or receive.

original: de bas na don dam par yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba gang yang med do //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, there is no such thing as giving up.

original: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / mal cha la sogs pa yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa de dag ni kun brtags pa'i chos la gnas pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi tshe dang sgyu ma bzhin te /
analyzed: bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / mal cha la sogs pa yongs su gtong ba gang yin pa de dag ni kun brtags pa'i chos la gnas pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi tshe dang sgyu ma bzhin te /
translated: The giving of food, drink, bedding, and so on is like a dream or an illusion, because it is based on imputed phenomena.

original: yang dag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not real.

original: de ltar don dam par yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid la yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul zhes bya'o //üîΩyongs su gtong ba med pa'i rigs pa des dngos po la sbyin par bya ba dang / bdag la gtong ba po dang / slong ba la len par byed pa dang gsum mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid la yongs su gtong ba med pa'i tshul zhes bya'o // yongs su gtong ba med pa'i rigs pa des dngos po la sbyin par bya ba dang / bdag la gtong ba po dang / slong ba la len par byed pa dang gsum mi dmigs te /
translated: Thus, the absence of giving in the ultimate sense is called the method of the absence of giving.

original: mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: By that method of the absence of giving, the three things‚Äîthe thing given, the giver, and the receiver‚Äîare not apprehended in things, because they are free from the nature of non-apprehension.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //üîΩdang por rgyu ni snying rje'i stobs kyi kun rdzob kyi tshul la gnas te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o // dang por rgyu ni snying rje'i stobs kyi kun rdzob kyi tshul la gnas te /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of giving is fulfilled.

original: 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis sbyin pa byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis sbyin pa byed do //
translated: First, by the power of compassion, one abides in the conventional method and gives gifts by the power of worldly conduct.

original: de nas shes rab kyi dbang gis don dam pa'i tshul la gnas te /
analyzed: de nas shes rab kyi dbang gis don dam pa'i tshul la gnas te /
translated: Then, by the power of wisdom, one abides in the ultimate method.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis thams cad kyang shes rab kyis yongs su brtags na dmigs su med par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod pa'i dbang gis thams cad kyang shes rab kyis yongs su brtags na dmigs su med par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: And by the power of supramundane conduct, when all things are thoroughly investigated by wisdom and become non-apprehensible,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the perfection of generosity is said to be complete.

original: de bas na dang po sems bskyed pa'i dmigs par gyur ba sems can dang / byang chub gnyis yongs su ma btang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na dang po sems bskyed pa'i dmigs par gyur ba sems can dang / byang chub gnyis yongs su ma btang bar gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the two objects of the first generation of the mind, sentient beings and enlightenment, are not abandoned.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming de yang don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i ming de yang don dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And so the name ‚Äúbodhisattva‚Äù also becomes meaningful.

original: de lta na sbyin par bya ba dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa po rnams mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dag shin tu 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta na sbyin par bya ba dang / gtong ba po dang / len pa po rnams mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dag shin tu 'gal ba yin na /
translated: In that case, if the object to be given, the giver, and the receiver are not apprehended, and generosity is utterly contradictory,

original: ji ltar mi 'gal ba bzhin du byed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gal ba bzhin du byed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can it be practiced without contradiction?

original: thabs mkhas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthus rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Skill in means is made possible by the power of the perfections.

original: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni kun rdzob 'dzin pa'i snying rje dang / don dam pa mi 'dzin pa'i shes rab gnyis kyis skam la rgyu ba dang / chu la rgyu ba'i srog chags kyi sbyor ba bzhin du shin tu 'gal ba yin du zin yang /üîΩsbyor ba'i rnam pas 'gal ba med par grogs byas @29a * //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni kun rdzob 'dzin pa'i snying rje dang / don dam pa mi 'dzin pa'i shes rab gnyis kyis skam la rgyu ba dang / chu la rgyu ba'i srog chags kyi sbyor ba bzhin du shin tu 'gal ba yin du zin yang / sbyor ba'i rnam pas 'gal ba med par grogs byas @29a * //
translated: Although these two are extremely contradictory, like the combination of a land animal and a water animal,

original: nas cig car sgrub cing byang chub kyi bar du spyod de /
analyzed: nas cig car sgrub cing byang chub kyi bar du spyod de /
translated: they are combined by the aspect of application, and they are simultaneously accomplished and practiced until enlightenment.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad bsgrubs na /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad bsgrubs na /
translated: If one accomplishes all the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog tu 'gyur te /
translated: it becomes the supreme benefit for bodhisattvas.

original: 'og nas kyang skabs ji lta ba de dang de dag tu de'i bshad pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'og nas kyang skabs ji lta ba de dang de dag tu de'i bshad pa 'byung ngo //
translated: This will be explained below in the appropriate sections.

original: ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of moral discipline should be completed in order to prevent downfalls and to prevent excessive downfalls.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni khyim pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i bslab pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i sdom pa'i bslab pa gnyis yang dag par blangs te gnas pa na ltung ba byung na yang dus las yol bar lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung gi myur zhing myur du mthol bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni khyim pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa'i bslab pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i sdom pa'i bslab pa gnyis yang dag par blangs te gnas pa na ltung ba byung na yang dus las yol bar lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung gi myur zhing myur du mthol bar byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva, having taken up the two trainings in the vow of the lay bodhisattva and the vow of the monk, when he does fall, does not let the transgression remain for a moment, but quickly and quickly confesses it.

original: de bas na ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang / lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ltung ba mi 'byung ba dang / lhag par ltung ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause there is no transgression and no remaining in a transgression.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya bar snyegs te /üîΩbdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya bar snyegs te / bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Here also, the reference is to ‚Äústanding in the perfection of wisdom.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúI am moral,‚Äù

original: bdag ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims so //
translated: ‚ÄúI am morality,‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims so zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gsum mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims so zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gsum mi dmigs pas /
translated: ‚Äúthis is immorality,‚Äù are the three discriminations that are not apprehended.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the three spheres are completely pure.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan no //
translated: ‚ÄúI am endowed with morality.‚Äù

original: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is morality.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThis is immorality.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims so zhes bya ba'i rlom sems su mi byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims so zhes bya ba'i rlom sems su mi byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One should not engage in such conceit.

original: 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of patience is completed because of non-agitation.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: This teaches the essential nature of the perfection of patience.

original: de yang snying rje'i dbang gis sems can gyi 'du byed rnams la 'khrug pa med pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang snying rje'i dbang gis sems can gyi 'du byed rnams la 'khrug pa med pa dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is because of compassion that there is no agitation with regard to the formative forces of sentient beings, and it is because of wisdom that one realizes selflessness.

original: 'dir yang bzod pa dang / bzod par bya ba dang / gnod sems rnams mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ni 'og nas skabs ji lta ba nyid du 'chad do //
analyzed: 'dir yang bzod pa dang / bzod par bya ba dang / gnod sems rnams mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ni 'og nas skabs ji lta ba nyid du 'chad do //
translated: Here, patience, the object of patience, and malice are not apprehended. The complete purity of the three spheres is explained below in the appropriate contexts.

original: lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa bstan te /
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa bstan te /
translated: The perfection of effort is completed because there is no decline of physical and mental effort. This shows the entry into the perfection of effort.

original: rgyun du chud pa dang / @29b gus pa dang / nan tan du lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed par brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun du chud pa dang / @29b gus pa dang / nan tan du lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus nyams par mi byed par brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The perfection of effort is completed by not allowing the physical and mental effort to decline, which is to say, by being constant, respectful, and diligent.

original: nyams pa med pa de yang shes rab dang snying rje gnyis kyis 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: nyams pa med pa de yang shes rab dang snying rje gnyis kyis 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: And that non-decline is due to both wisdom and compassion.

original: 'dir yang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang le lo rnams mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / brtson 'grus dang le lo rnams mi dmigs pas pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, too, the perfection is due to the non-apprehension of effort and laziness.

original: ro myang ba med pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ro myang ba med pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of meditation is completed because there is no relishing.

original: gal te bdag gi don du bsam gtan la 'jug na ni bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar byed par 'gyur na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi don 'ba' zhig la sbyor ba thams cad la sdig pa bzhin du rnam par smod par byed na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi don du bsam gtan la 'jug na ni bsam gtan gyi ro myong bar byed par 'gyur na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi don 'ba' zhig la sbyor ba thams cad la sdig pa bzhin du rnam par smod par byed na /
translated: If he were to enter into meditative concentration for his own sake, he would experience the taste of meditative concentration. But the bodhisattva completely condemns all application to his own sake as if it were a sin.

original: de la bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba'i yid la byed pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi ro myang ba'i yid la byed pa lta ga la yod /
translated: How then could he have a mental orientation that experiences the taste of meditative concentration?

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa can dang / dag pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gsum las dag pa dang / zag pa med pa nyid la snyoms par 'jug gi / nyon mongs pa can la ni mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa can dang / dag pa dang / zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gsum las dag pa dang / zag pa med pa nyid la snyoms par 'jug gi / nyon mongs pa can la ni mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, he enters into meditative concentration only in the pure and uncontaminated states, not in the defiled state.

original: 'dir yang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang g-yeng ba rnams mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: 'dir yang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang g-yeng ba rnams mi dmigs pas /
translated: Here also, through the nonapprehension of meditative concentration and distraction,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: he perfects the transcendences.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid tsam du mthong bas ni 'jig rten pa'i kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs la /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de bzhin nyid tsam du mthong bas ni 'jig rten pa'i kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs la /
translated: Because of seeing just thusness, all the dharmas imagined by the world are not apprehended,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: and also the supramundane is not imagined.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //üîΩji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro // ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /
translated: How does the perfection of wisdom, standing in the perfection of wisdom, complete the perfection of wisdom?

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po la bya ba de'i tshe na ni klan kar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po la bya ba de'i tshe na ni klan kar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: When the perfection of wisdom is called the knowledge of all modes and the Great Vehicle, then there is no occasion for a question.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab la bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab la bya bar gyur pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: When it is the nonconceptual wisdom that is the object, then

original: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos gang yang med do snyam du sems pas shes rab kyi @30a * //
analyzed: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos gang yang med do snyam du sems pas shes rab kyi @30a * //
translated: one thinks, ‚ÄúIn the ultimate, there is no phenomenon of the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, one abides in the nonconceptual perfection of wisdom, which is the nonconceptual nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i tshe ni khams gsum la sogs pa de bzhin nyid tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni khams gsum la sogs pa de bzhin nyid tsam du zad do //
translated: At that time, the three realms and so on are simply suchness.

original: kun rdzob kyi rnam par skyes pa'i shes rab sbyor ba'i lam du gtogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rnam par skyes pa'i shes rab sbyor ba'i lam du gtogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wisdom that arises in the aspect of the conventional, which belongs to the path of preparation, is conceptual. However, because it is embraced by nonconceptual wisdom, it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Therefore, one abides in the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par dgongs pas klan kar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom par dgongs pas klan kar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in the intention to cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir yang shes rab can dang shes rab dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab rnams mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes rab can dang shes rab dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab rnams mi dmigs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, too, it should be understood that the perfection of wisdom, the one who has wisdom, and the one who has faulty wisdom are all completely pure in the three spheres, because they are not apprehended.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa bshad zin nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa bshad zin nas /
translated: Thus, the practice of the perfection of non-conceptuality has been explained.

original: da ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the practice of the factors of enlightenment without afflictions should be taught.

original: de yang sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de yang sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: And that is taught in the passage beginning with Sharadviati, the bodhisattva mahasattva, abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: for the sake of completing the four establishments of mindfulness, should not apprehend the establishments of mindfulness.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sgom pa ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal gyi theg pa pa mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar byed pa rnams nyid la rigs kyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams sgom pa ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal gyi theg pa pa mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar byed pa rnams nyid la rigs kyi /
translated: It is appropriate for those in the vehicles of the listeners and the solitary realizers, who are intent on nirvana, to cultivate the elements that lead to enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: But it is not appropriate for bodhisattvas.

original: yang 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: yang 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in this,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par bzhed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs par bzhed cing /
translated: because bodhisattvas wish to realize all phenomena in all their aspects

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa lhur len pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa lhur len pas /
translated: and they are intent on not observing any phenomena.

original: ci byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams don dam par yod dam 'on te med ces de dag la yongs su brtag par rigs so //
analyzed: ci byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams don dam par yod dam 'on te med ces de dag la yongs su brtag par rigs so //
translated: So it is appropriate for them to investigate whether the elements that lead to enlightenment exist ultimately or not.

original: 'on te de ltar gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar gyur na /
translated: But if that is the case,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pa'i rgyus mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pa'i rgyus mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: then through cultivating the elements that lead to enlightenment, they would actualize nirvana,

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rgyun du zhugs pa nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rgyun du zhugs pa nas /
translated: but bodhisattvas do not actualize nirvana.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro zhe na yang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ro zhe na yang /
translated: Even if they attain the state of an arhat,

original: sngon gyi rtsol ba'i shugs kyi mthu nyid kyis de 'grub pa'i @30b phyir 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sngon gyi rtsol ba'i shugs kyi mthu nyid kyis de 'grub pa'i @30b phyir 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault in this, because they accomplish that through the power of the momentum of their previous efforts.

original: gang dag 'khor ba la nyes dmigs su mthong nas yid byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du mthong nas de nyid don du gnyer zhing bsgrub pa de dag ni sngon gyi rtsol ba'i shugs kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom pa'i rgyus 'bad mi dgos par mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed
analyzed: gang dag 'khor ba la nyes dmigs su mthong nas yid byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du mthong nas de nyid don du gnyer zhing bsgrub pa de dag ni sngon gyi rtsol ba'i shugs kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams bsgom pa'i rgyus 'bad mi dgos par mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed
translated: Those who, having seen the faults of cyclic existence, are disgusted with it and having seen the virtues of nirvana, strive for and accomplish it, will, through the cause of cultivating the applications of mindfulness through the momentum of their previous efforts,

original: par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: par 'gyur gyi /
translated: inevitably actualize nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sems mnyam pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sems mnyam pa /
translated: Bodhisattvas, who have an attitude of equanimity toward cyclic existence and nirvana,

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba bskyed pa lhur len pa dag ni sems can la phan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la yang mya ngan las 'das ba bzhin du yon tan du gzigs la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba bskyed pa lhur len pa dag ni sems can la phan pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba la yang mya ngan las 'das ba bzhin du yon tan du gzigs la /
translated: Those who are intent on generating benefit and happiness for all sentient beings are the cause of benefit for sentient beings. Therefore, they see samsara as having good qualities, just like nirvana.

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are the cause of benefit for sentient beings and they are the cause of generating the bliss of sentient beings.üîΩThey do not view nirvana as superior to samsara, because nirvana is not the basis for benefiting sentient beings.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'khor ba bzhin du mi mthun bar gzigs pa dang chos nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir de gnyi ga yang mnyam pa nyid du gzigs pas dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du so sor rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogsüîΩkyi chos rnams bsgoms te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'khor ba bzhin du mi mthun bar gzigs pa dang chos nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir de gnyi ga yang mnyam pa nyid du gzigs pas dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du so sor rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgoms te /
translated: They view both samsara and nirvana as equal, because they realize that they are the nature of nonapprehending.üîΩThey cultivate the factors conducive to enlightenment.

original: de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams mngon sum du mdzad pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams mngon sum du mdzad pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: They merely manifest the factors conducive to enlightenment.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'am ;
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'am ;
translated: They do not manifest the result of stream enterer and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not abide in nirvana because it manifests nirvana.

original: de nyid la yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'di ltar 'og nas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas nas 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid la yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o // 'di ltar 'og nas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la gnas nas 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi /
translated: That is called the knowledge of thorough familiarity.

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin par shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pas yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa bstan pa las 'chad do //üîΩdran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de la lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams dang ; rnam pa bzhi rnams la rjes su lta ba rnam pa bzhi la /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin par shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pas yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa bstan pa las 'chad do // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de la lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams dang ; rnam pa bzhi rnams la rjes su lta ba rnam pa bzhi la /
translated: Thus, later on, it will be explained that the knowledge of thorough familiarity is taught by the statement, ‚ÄúOne should know that this is the time for thorough familiarity with the factors of enlightenment, but it is not the time for manifesting them.‚ÄùüîΩThe four establishments of mindfulness should be completed because the non-apprehension of the establishments of mindfulness is taught.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the four establishments of mindfulness are called the four establishments of mindfulness because of the four kinds of subsequent insight into the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena.

original: sngar yongs su shes par byas nas de'i 'og tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rtog pa na /
analyzed: sngar yongs su shes par byas nas de'i 'og tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rtog pa na /
translated: Having previously understood them, one subsequently correctly analyzes them.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams dang / @31a * //
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams dang / @31a * //
translated: One realizes that the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas,

original: de dag la dmigs pa'i dran pa dang / shes rab gnyis dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pas yang dag pa'i don ma yin par yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa'i dran pa dang / shes rab gnyis dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pas yang dag pa'i don ma yin par yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: the two of mindfulness and wisdom that focus on them, and the dharmas of mind that are concomitant with them are the imagined characteristic, and thus one should understand that they are not the correct meaning.

original: don dam par brjod du med pa ni dran pa dang shes rab gnyis kyi spyod yul ma yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin par rtogs nas /
analyzed: don dam par brjod du med pa ni dran pa dang shes rab gnyis kyi spyod yul ma yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par yod pa ma yin par rtogs nas /
translated: Since the ultimate is inexpressible, it is not the domain of the two of mindfulness and wisdom. Thus, having realized that the characteristic of the applications of mindfulness does not exist ultimately,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: one abides in the perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya'o //
translated: It is said that one perfects the applications of mindfulness.

original: de bas na 'bum pa 'di nyid las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'bum pa 'di nyid las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in this very Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, it says:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dmigs su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Because the applications of mindfulness are non-apprehensible.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe four right efforts should be completed.‚Äù

original: brtson 'grus kyis dge ba bskyed cing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong bas na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis dge ba bskyed cing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams spong bas na /
translated: Because of the generation of virtue and the elimination of non-virtuous dharmas through effort,

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: there are the four right efforts.

original: de yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
analyzed: de yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
translated: Moreover, in order that non-virtuous dharmas not yet arisen do not arise, one generates will,

original: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom /
analyzed: 'bad / brtson 'grus rtsom /
translated: strives, brings forth heroism,

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to zhes bya ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed ces bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to zhes bya ba dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed ces bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: and seizes the mind well, and in order that non-virtuous dharmas already arisen are eliminated, one generates will, and so on, and in order that virtuous dharmas not yet arisen are generated, one generates will, and so on,üîΩand in order that virtuous dharmas already arisen remain, are not forgotten, are not lost, are more fully developed, are increased, expanded, and completed, one generates will, and so on.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / phyir zhing 'phel ba dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / phyir zhing 'phel ba dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed /
translated: In order to maintain the virtuous dharmas that have arisen, to increase them, to not let them diminish, and to perfect them, one generates enthusiasm,

original: 'bad ; brtson 'grus rtsom /
analyzed: 'bad ; brtson 'grus rtsom /
translated: strives, exerts effort,

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to zhes bya'o //
translated: and fully engages the mind.üîΩThe four bases of supernatural powers should be perfected.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang /
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers are the base of supernatural powers endowed with the concentration and exertion of aspiration, the base of supernatural powers endowed with the concentration and exertion of mind,

original: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom pa ste /
translated: the base of supernatural powers endowed with the concentration and exertion of diligence, and the base of supernatural powers endowed with the concentration and exertion of analysis.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di bzhis rdzu 'phrul dang / 'phags pa'i yon tan @31b dang ; 'byor pa chen po thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / rten dang gzhi yin pas rkang pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di bzhis rdzu 'phrul dang / 'phags pa'i yon tan @31b dang ; 'byor pa chen po thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / rten dang gzhi yin pas rkang pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These four concentrations are called bases of supernatural power because they are the cause, support and basis for attaining supernatural power, the qualities of the noble ones and great prosperity, and are therefore like feet.

original: dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: One should perfect the five faculties: the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration and the faculty of wisdom.

original: dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi dbang gis zag pa med pa'i chos nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi dbang gis zag pa med pa'i chos nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called faculties because one attains the uncontaminated dharmas through the power of these faculties of faith and so on.

original: stobs lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stobs lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should perfect the five powers:

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po de dag nyid goms pa'i mthus nyon mongs pa'i phyogs rnams kyis zil gyis mi non te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga po de dag nyid goms pa'i mthus nyon mongs pa'i phyogs rnams kyis zil gyis mi non te /
translated: Through the power of cultivating those five faculties of faith and so on, one is not overwhelmed by the side of afflictions.

original: mthu dang ldan par gyur pa la stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthu dang ldan par gyur pa la stobs lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: The five faculties of faith and so on are called the five powers when they become so powerful that the side of the afflictions cannot overpower them through the force of habituation.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi yan lag bdun yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi yan lag bdun yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The seven factors of awakening should be fully accomplished.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: The seven factors of awakening are the awakening factor of mindfulness, the awakening factor of investigation of phenomena, the awakening factor of perseverance, the awakening factor of joy, the awakening factor of pliancy,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: the awakening factor of concentration, and the awakening factor of equanimity.

original: sa dang po la byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyis chos nyid rtogs par byed pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sa dang po la byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyis chos nyid rtogs par byed pa'i dus na /
translated: On the first ground, when one realizes the reality that is the nature of enlightenment,

original: dran pa la sogs pa 'di rnams rgyu dang grogs su gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa 'di rnams rgyu dang grogs su gyur pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: these such as mindfulness are the causes and the companions, and so they are called the branches of enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The noble eightfold path should be brought to completion.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: This refers to right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams te /
translated: and right concentration.

original: sa dang po thob nas sa bcu'i bar du bsgom pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sa dang po thob nas sa bcu'i bar du bsgom pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i tshe /
translated: Once one has attained the first ground, when one enters the path of meditation up to the tenth ground,

original: 'di rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: one possesses these, and so they are called the noble eightfold path.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa 'di yang 'og nas theg pa chen po bstan pa las rgyas par 'chad do//
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa 'di yang 'og nas theg pa chen po bstan pa las rgyas par 'chad do//
translated: This cultivation of the factors of enlightenment will be explained extensively below in the teaching on the Great Vehicle.

original: @32a * // yang dag par spong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su shes par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas
analyzed: @32a * // yang dag par spong ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yongs su shes par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas
translated: Since the characteristics of the right efforts and so on are the nature of non-entityness, one should understand that the right efforts and so on have the nature of non-apprehension, and abide in the perfection of wisdom

original: te / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: te / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: and perfect the factors of enlightenment.üîΩOne should perfect the emptiness meditative stabilization is explained.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang rjes su mthun zhing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang rjes su mthun zhing /
translated: The three doors of liberation are concordant with the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: and because they cause the attainment of nirvana,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs nyid kyi nang du bgrang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs nyid kyi nang du bgrang ngo //
translated: they are counted among the factors of enlightenment themselves.

original: 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i skabs su gtogs pas ting nge 'dzin gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i skabs su gtogs pas ting nge 'dzin gsum du brjod do //
translated: Here, since it belongs to the context of the bodhisattva, it is called the three samadhis.

original: de la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: Among them, the samadhi of emptiness, which has the characteristic of the thoroughly established nature,

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: is empty of the characteristic of the imputed nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i rnam pa des stong ngo zhes stong pa'i rnam par bsgoms na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rnam pa des stong ngo zhes stong pa'i rnam par bsgoms na /
translated: When one meditates on emptiness in the aspect of being empty of the imputed aspect,

original: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: the mind becomes one-pointed, and that is called the samadhi of emptiness.

original: brjod du med pa'i don dam pa de nyid nam mkha' bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i don dam pa de nyid nam mkha' bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: That inexpressible ultimate is like space, free from all characteristics such as form,

original: mtshan ma'i rnam pa med pa'i mtshan nyid spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin pas zhi ba'i rnam par bsgoms na /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam pa med pa'i mtshan nyid spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin pas zhi ba'i rnam par bsgoms na /
translated: and has the characteristic of the absence of aspects of characteristics. Since all elaborations are pacified, when one meditates on it in the aspect of peace,

original: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: the mind becomes one-pointed, and that is called the samadhi of signlessness.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par mthong bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum pa rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par mthong bas /
translated: Likewise, by seeing the three realms as the nature of non-entityness,

original: chos thams cad la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mi mthun pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag nas /
translated: having established the perception of all phenomena as disagreeable,

original: phyis de la smon pa'i gnas su mi byed par yang dag par rjes su mthong pa na sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis de la smon pa'i gnas su mi byed par yang dag par rjes su mthong pa na sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa la smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: later, when one sees that they are not a basis for aspiration, then one-pointed mind is called the concentration of wishlessness.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa med pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi spyod pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the practice of the factors of enlightenment without affliction,

original: de ni bar du gcod pa med par sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni bar du gcod pa med par sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the practice of ripening sentient beings without obstruction,

original: bsam gtan mi dmigs pa'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan mi dmigs pa'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, For the sake of completing the four concentrations without observing concentration... and so on.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba de yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam @32b gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs dang / mngon par shes pa'i phyogs dang / ye shes kyi phyogs kyis bya dgos pas /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba de yang 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam @32b gtan dang ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs dang / mngon par shes pa'i phyogs dang / ye shes kyi phyogs kyis bya dgos pas /
translated: Moreover, that maturation of sentient beings is to be done by means of the mundane and supramundane side of meditative concentration, the side of superknowledge, and the side of intuition.

original: phyogs kyi chos gsum char yang der 'dus te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos gsum char yang der 'dus te /
translated: Thus, the three topics are included in that.

original: de la bsam gtan la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang por sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu bzung ste ;
analyzed: de la bsam gtan la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang por sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu bzung ste ;
translated: Therein, all dharmas such as meditative concentration are first taken up conventionally for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.üîΩLater, when they are thoroughly investigated in the ultimate, one does not settle down on the nature of meditative concentration, etc.

original: phyis don dam par yongs su brtags na bsam gtan la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed par snying rje dang / thabs mkhas pa gnyis kyis slar yang kun rdzob nyid la dmigs nas sems can la phan par byed pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phyis don dam par yongs su brtags na bsam gtan la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed par snying rje dang / thabs mkhas pa gnyis kyis slar yang kun rdzob nyid la dmigs nas sems can la phan par byed pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Then, with compassion and skill in means, one again focuses on the conventional and benefits sentient beings. Thus, the conduct of maturing sentient beings is presented.

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa rnams te /
translated: The four meditations are the first, second, third, and fourth meditations of the form realm.

original: bsam gtan de dag kyang /
analyzed: bsam gtan de dag kyang /
translated: These meditations are as follows:

original: bsam gtan dang po'i ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o ;
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o ;
translated: The first meditation is associated with investigation and sustained thought.

original: / bsam gtan gnyis pa ni rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: / bsam gtan gnyis pa ni rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The second meditation is associated with sustained thought alone, without investigation.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa gnyis ni rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bzhi pa gnyis ni rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa ste /
translated: The third and fourth meditations are both without investigation and without sustained thought.

original: bsam gtan de dag 'jig rten pa rnams ni bdag tu lta ba dang bcas par bsgom /
analyzed: bsam gtan de dag 'jig rten pa rnams ni bdag tu lta ba dang bcas par bsgom /
translated: These meditations are cultivated by worldly beings with the view of self.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni gang zag la bdag med par rtogs nas bsgom mo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni gang zag la bdag med par rtogs nas bsgom mo //
translated: They are cultivated by the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas after they have realized the selflessness of persons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos dang gang zag gnyis la bdag med par rtogs nas bsgoms te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos dang gang zag gnyis la bdag med par rtogs nas bsgoms te /
translated: They are cultivated by the bodhisattvas after they have realized the selflessness of both persons and phenomena.

original: don dam par bsam gtan dmigs su med kyang /
analyzed: don dam par bsam gtan dmigs su med kyang /
translated: Although the ultimate is not an object of meditation,

original: kun rdzob tu snying rje dang thabs mkhas pa gnyis kyi dbang gis so so'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom mo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu snying rje dang thabs mkhas pa gnyis kyi dbang gis so so'i mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom mo //
translated: One should cultivate them in accordance with their individual characteristics by the power of compassion and skillful means on the conventional level.üîΩOne should complete the four immeasurables.

original: tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms rnams te /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms rnams te /
translated: The four are love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de bzhi char la yang byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum gyis bsgom ste /
analyzed: de bzhi char la yang byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum gyis bsgom ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas cultivate all four in three ways.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pas bsgom pa'o //üîΩgzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye @33a * //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pas bsgom pa'o // gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye @33a * //
translated: Cultivation with reference to sentient beings, cultivation with reference to the Dharma, and cultivation with reference to the absence of reference.üîΩOne should complete the four formless absorptions.

original: mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched do //
analyzed: mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched do //
translated: The four are the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba dang / nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba dang / sdug pa'i rnam pa la mos pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba dang / nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba dang / sdug pa'i rnam pa la mos pa dang /
translated: 3) being intent on the aspect of beauty,üîΩ4-7) the four formless absorptions of the sphere of infinite space and so on,
