original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang brgyad do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang brgyad do //
translated: and 8) the concentration of the cessation of discriminations and feelings.üîΩThe nine serial absorptions are:üîΩthe four concentrations,üîΩthe four formless absorptions, and

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang dgu'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang dgu'o //
translated: the concentration of the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The five superknowledges are:

original: lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang ; / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang ; / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of the thoughts of others, the knowledge of the accomplishment of supernormal power, and the knowledge of the recollection of former abodes.

original: 'du shes bcu bsgom par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'du shes bcu bsgom par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: One should cultivate the ten perceptions, etc.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por rnam par bam pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes bcu bsgom pa bstan to//
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por rnam par bam pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes bcu bsgom pa bstan to//
translated: This teaches the cultivation of the ten perceptions of a bloated corpse, etc., as the antidote to desire.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One should cultivate the recollection of the Buddha, etc.

original: lha rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rjes su dran pa drug bsgom pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lha rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rjes su dran pa drug bsgom pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the cultivation of the six recollections, from the recollection of the Buddha up to the recollection of the gods.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa kha lo sgyur ba skyes bu 'dul ba bla na med pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa kha lo sgyur ba skyes bu 'dul ba bla na med pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha is the recollection of the Blessed One, the Buddha, in terms of his qualities, such as being endowed with knowledge and conduct, being an unsurpassed trainer of those to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed one, etc.

original: chos rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lung gi chos dang / thob par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lung gi chos dang / thob par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: One should cultivate recollection of the Dharma, which refers to the Dharma of the scriptures and the Dharma that is to be realized.

original: de la lung gi chos ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa theg pa che chung gi gsung rab rnams kyi yon tan rjes su dran pa'o//
analyzed: de la lung gi chos ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa theg pa che chung gi gsung rab rnams kyi yon tan rjes su dran pa'o//
translated: Recollection of the Dharma of the scriptures refers to the qualities of the scriptures of the Great and Small Vehicles, such as the Sutra Pitaka, etc.

original: thob par bya ba'i chos ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i chos dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i chos ni rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i chos dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Recollection of the Dharma that is to be realized refers to the qualities of the Dharma of the result of Stream-enterer, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha, etc.

original: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni @33b 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad la /
analyzed: dge 'dun rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni @33b 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad la /
translated: One should cultivate recollection of the Sa·πÖgha, which refers to the eight kinds of noble persons.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni 'phags pa'i lam la gnas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni 'phags pa'i lam la gnas pa /
translated: The Sa·πÖgha of the Bhagavat‚Äôs ≈õrƒÅvakas is established in the noble path.

original: shin tu legs par zhugs pa sbyin gnas chen po bsod nams kyi zhing yin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas rjes su dran par bya ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu legs par zhugs pa sbyin gnas chen po bsod nams kyi zhing yin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas rjes su dran par bya ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: One should cultivate recollection by way of the virtues of the one who has entered well, the great field of merit, etc.

original: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sdom pa gsum dang / ngag gi sdom pa bzhi bsdams shing srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bdun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid la mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan gyi sgo nas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sdom pa gsum dang / ngag gi sdom pa bzhi bsdams shing srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa bdun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid la mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan gyi sgo nas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: One should cultivate recollection of morality, i.e., recollection of the virtues of the seven types of abstention, such as abstention from killing, etc., which have the characteristic of the restraint of the three bodily and four verbal actions, and which are the cause of rebirth in the heavens.

original: gtong ba rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos dang / zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i longs spyod chen po'i rgyu yin pa'i sgo nas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: gtong ba rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos dang / zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i longs spyod chen po'i rgyu yin pa'i sgo nas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: One should cultivate recollection of giving, i.e., recollection of the virtues of giving Dharma, material things, and freedom from fear, which are the cause of great mundane and supramundane enjoyments.

original: lha rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams las bzang po dang / bsod nams chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas brnyas shing smad par bya bar mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: lha rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lha rnams las bzang po dang / bsod nams chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yin pas brnyas shing smad par bya bar mi rigs kyi /
translated: One should cultivate mindfulness of the gods. The gods are the source of all that is good and of great merit, both mundane and supramundane. It is not right to despise or disparage them.

original: mchod pa dang bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin pa'i sgo nas rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin pa'i sgo nas rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: One should be mindful of them as objects of worship and veneration.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la sems sbyang zhing las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran par bya ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la sems sbyang zhing las su rung bar bya ba'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba rjes su dran par bya ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: One should cultivate mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation. One should cultivate mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation in order to train and render serviceable the mind in the cultivation of concentration and meditative absorption.

original: skyo ba rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
analyzed: skyo ba rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
translated: One should cultivate recollection of disenchantment with regard to birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, anxiety,üîΩand tribulation, etc.

original: 'khrugs pa la sogs pa yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnas rnams la dmigs nas nyes dmigs su lta zhing skyo ba rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa la sogs pa yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnas rnams la dmigs nas nyes dmigs su lta zhing skyo ba rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: One should observe the disadvantages of the realms of existence, and recollect disenchantment with regard to them.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyo ba rjes su dran pa ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyo ba rjes su dran pa ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva recollects disenchantment when he sees that all things are by nature selfless,üîΩbut that the childish, generating the idea that they have an essence, engage in them.

original: byis pa rnams kyis snying po can du blo bskyed de 'jug par mthong nas de dag shes par bya bar myur du sngon du gtong ba'i yid la byed pa ni skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis snying po can du blo bskyed de 'jug par mthong nas de dag shes par bya bar myur du sngon du gtong ba'i yid la byed pa ni skyo ba rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental attention that is quickly directed toward the understanding of those [childish beings] is called recollection of disenchantment.

original: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba yang skyo ba rjes su dran par bya ba nyid kyi @34a * //
analyzed: 'chi ba rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba yang skyo ba rjes su dran par bya ba nyid kyi @34a * //
translated: One should cultivate mindfulness of death means one should cultivate mindfulness of disenchantment.

original: nang du gtogs mod kyi logs shig tu bkar te /
analyzed: nang du gtogs mod kyi logs shig tu bkar te /
translated: The statement one should cultivate mindfulness of death is included in the cultivation of mindfulness of the repulsive, but it is mentioned separately

original: smos pa ni lhag par skyo bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smos pa ni lhag par skyo bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a cause of special disgust.

original: lus rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus la ma chags par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus la ma chags par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The statement one should cultivate mindfulness of the body is for the purpose of non-attachment to the body.

original: glad pa'i rgyas nas rkang pa'i bar du mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: glad pa'i rgyas nas rkang pa'i bar du mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of the body as filled with various impurities, from the top of the head down to the soles of the feet.üîΩThe three beginning with the statement one should cultivate the perception of impermanence are the cultivation of the perception of impermanence,

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po lnga la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po lnga la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o //
translated: suffering, and non-self in the five aggregates of clinging.

original: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par bam pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes bcu gong du smos pa nyid mdor bsdus te bsgom pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par bam pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes bcu gong du smos pa nyid mdor bsdus te bsgom pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the perception of the foul is the meditation on the ten perceptions of the bloated, etc. mentioned above, in brief.

original: 'chi ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba gang du yang 'chi ba'i 'du shes smos pas lan gnyis su zlos pa 'dra ba /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba gang du yang 'chi ba'i 'du shes smos pas lan gnyis su zlos pa 'dra ba /
translated: The meditation on the perception of death is mentioned twice, but the second time it is called the meditation on the perception of non-delight in the entire world.

original: gong du smos pa ni rjes su dran pa'i skabs yin ;
analyzed: gong du smos pa ni rjes su dran pa'i skabs yin ;
translated: The former is in the context of recollection,

original: 'di ni 'du shes kyi skabs yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du shes kyi skabs yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: but the latter is in the context of perception, so there is no fault of repetition.

original: dga' bar bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad la dga' bar mi bya ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rigs pa dang / bzo'i gnas thams cad dang / sgyu rtsal rnam pa sna tshogs drug cu rtsa bzhi la sogs pa la mngon par dga' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bar bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad la dga' bar mi bya ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rigs pa dang / bzo'i gnas thams cad dang / sgyu rtsal rnam pa sna tshogs drug cu rtsa bzhi la sogs pa la mngon par dga' bar mi bya'o //
translated: The meditation on the perception of non-delight in the entire world is the non-delight in all worldly reasoning, all crafts, and the sixty-four kinds of arts, etc.

original: yid brtan du mi rung ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa la chags su rung ba'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas de la 'dod pa med par gyur ba'o //üîΩsdug bsngal shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kun rdzob kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: yid brtan du mi rung ba'i 'du shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa la chags su rung ba'i rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas de la 'dod pa med par gyur ba'o // sdug bsngal shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kun rdzob kyi sgo nas /
translated: This means that, since one does not see any cause for attachment to the three realms, one becomes free from desire for them.üîΩOne should cultivate the knowledge of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid du shes par byas nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid du shes par byas nas /
translated: This means that, having understood all the dharmas of the aggregates, etc., as suffering, from the point of view of the conventional,

original: de'i 'og tu de dag nyid don dam par shin tu dngos po med par shes kyang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag nyid don dam par shin tu dngos po med par shes kyang /
translated: then, subsequently, one understands that they are absolutely without any reality.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: However, in order to develop living beings,

original: kun rdzob tu sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa nyid du shes pa dang / gzhan la yang de bzhin du shes par byed pa'i sdug bsngal shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa nyid du shes pa dang / gzhan la yang de bzhin du shes par byed pa'i sdug bsngal shes pa ste /
translated: one understands the aspects of suffering conventionally, and one causes others to understand them in the same way. This is the knowledge of suffering.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same method applies to all the other [members of the chain of dependent origination].

original: kun 'byung ba shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa de dag @34b nyid rab tu skye bar shes pa dang / de shes par byed pa'i shes pa yang kun 'byung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa de dag @34b nyid rab tu skye bar shes pa dang / de shes par byed pa'i shes pa yang kun 'byung ba shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of origination should be cultivated means the knowledge of the origination of those aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc. , and the knowledge that causes that to be known is the knowledge of origination.

original: 'gog pa shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par 'gog pa mi dmigs kyang /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par 'gog pa mi dmigs kyang /
translated: The knowledge of cessation should be cultivated means that ultimately cessation is not observed,

original: kun rdzob tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / shes par byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / shes par byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: but conventionally, in order to bring sentient beings to maturity, the knowledge of cessation, peace, excellence, and definitive release, and the knowledge that causes that to be known.

original: lam shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: lam shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The knowledge of the path should be cultivated means the conventional and ultimate modes as before,

original: lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam par shes shing shes par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam par shes shing shes par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of the path, reasoning, practice, and definitive release, and the knowledge that causes that to be known.

original: zad pa shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / sdug bsngal dang / bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi srid pa yongs su zad pa shes pa dang / yongs su zad pa'i rgyu shes pa ni ;
analyzed: zad pa shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / sdug bsngal dang / bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi srid pa yongs su zad pa shes pa dang / yongs su zad pa'i rgyu shes pa ni ;
translated: The knowledge of extinction should be cultivated. The knowledge of the extinction of all afflictions and secondary afflictions, of suffering, of the existence of self and others, and the knowledge of the cause of extinction

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: is the knowledge of extinction of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe knowledge of non-production should be cultivated. The knowledge of the non-production of all births in the migrations of existence of self and others, and the knowledge of the cause of non-production,

original: mi skye ba shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi srid pa'i 'gro bar skye ba thams cad shes pa dang / mi skye ba'i rgyu shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi srid pa'i 'gro bar skye ba thams cad shes pa dang / mi skye ba'i rgyu shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: is the knowledge of non-production of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe knowledge of the teaching should be cultivated. The knowledge of all teachings in the conventional sense, and the knowledge of reality by the power of the ultimate,

original: chos shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu chos thams cad mngon sum du shes pa dang / don dam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin nyid du shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos shes bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu chos thams cad mngon sum du shes pa dang / don dam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin nyid du shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: is the knowledge of the teaching.

original: rjes su rtogs pa shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu chos thams cad rjes su dpag pas shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa mngon sum du ma gyur kyang de lta bur 'gyur bar shes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rjes su mthun par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu chos thams cad rjes su dpag pas shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa mngon sum du ma gyur kyang de lta bur 'gyur bar shes pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rjes su mthun par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One should understand subsequent realization means that all phenomena are understood by inference in the conventional sense, and that even though impermanence and so forth are not directly perceived, one knows that they will become so. It is also the understanding by Bodhisattvas that all phenomena are in accordance with emptiness.

original: kun rdzob shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should cultivate conventional knowledge means

original: 'phags pa thams cad kyis sems can dang / bum pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i mkhyen pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad kyis sems can dang / bum pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i mkhyen pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that all noble beings know sentient beings, vases, and so forth, and that the knowledge of Bodhisattvas observes all phenomena, such as form, that are imputed.

original: yongs su 'dris pa shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnam @35a * //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa shes pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnam @35a * //
translated: One should cultivate knowledge of thorough acquaintance means that by whatever knowledge Bodhisattvas

original: par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom yang /
analyzed: par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom yang /
translated: Although they cultivate the doors to liberation, i.e., emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the factors of enlightenment,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du ni mi byed kyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du ni mi byed kyi /
translated: they do not actualize nirvana.

original: de dag nyid goms pa dang / rab tu byung bar byed pa'i shes pa de la yongs su 'dris pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid goms pa dang / rab tu byung bar byed pa'i shes pa de la yongs su 'dris pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that familiarizes with those very [doors to liberation and factors of enlightenment] and makes them manifest is called the knowledge of thorough familiarity.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed na ni /
translated: If they were to actualize nirvana,

original: de rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: they would become stream-enterers and so forth.

original: des dgos pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' la reg par mi byed kyi shes pa des chos tsam du sgom par byed do //
analyzed: des dgos pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' la reg par mi byed kyi shes pa des chos tsam du sgom par byed do //
translated: Because of that purpose, they do not touch the limit of reality, but cultivate mere phenomena with that knowledge.

original: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i chos rnams bsgoms pas ji ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i chos rnams bsgoms pas ji ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that by cultivating the factors that bring about the attainment of nirvana, they do not actualize the limit of reality?

original: skyo ba yid la byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar yang bshad do //
analyzed: skyo ba yid la byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar yang bshad do //
translated: Because they do not have the mental activity of weariness, as was explained earlier.

original: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the prerequisite for actualizing the very limit of reality is the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' thob par byed pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par sbyor ba mi mdzad kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' thob par byed pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par sbyor ba mi mdzad kyi /
translated: But bodhisattvas do not engage in the cultivation of serenity and insight that leads to the attainment of the very limit of reality.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med par bsgom pa rgyas par bya ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med par bsgom pa rgyas par bya ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir /
translated: They cultivate only the extensive meditation on the nonapprehension of all phenomena.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la dmigs pas na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la dmigs pas na /
translated: They discern the factors of enlightenment.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa tha mal pas so sor rtog go //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa tha mal pas so sor rtog go //
translated: They discern them with ordinary, nonconcentrated consciousness.

original: de bas na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because they do not have the conditions for serenity and insight, they do not actualize the very limit of reality.

original: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang rab 'byor gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la so sor rtog kyang mngon sum du bya'o snyam pas so sor rtog par mi byed kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og nas kyang rab 'byor gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la so sor rtog kyang mngon sum du bya'o snyam pas so sor rtog par mi byed kyang /
translated: Subhuti, when bodhisattva great beings discern emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all attributes, they do not discern it with the thought, I will actualize it.

original: 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi /
translated: This is the time to become thoroughly familiar with it.üîΩThis is not the time to actualize it.

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin no zhes so sor rtog cing mnyam par ma bzhag pa nyid du dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'jog kyang /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ni ma yin no zhes so sor rtog cing mnyam par ma bzhag pa nyid du dmigs pa la sems nye bar 'jog kyang /
translated: They discern this and, without settling down in evenness, they settle their minds on the focal point.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bar skabs der byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams las nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bar skabs der byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams las nyams par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: At that time, bodhisattva great beings do not regress from the factors of awakening.

original: zag pa zad pa mngon sum du yang mi byed do zhes bya ba la @35b sogs pa 'chad do //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mngon sum du yang mi byed do zhes bya ba la @35b sogs pa 'chad do //
translated: They do not actualize the destruction of the contaminants.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa shes pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra gang dang gang yin pa la sgra ji bzhin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa shes pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra gang dang gang yin pa la sgra ji bzhin zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase one should meditate by knowing the words as they are means that whatever the words are, they are called the words as they are.

original: de shes pa ni sgra ji bzhin shes pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ni sgra ji bzhin shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase knowing the words as they are means knowing the words as they are.

original: shes pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang ; lha dang / mi dang / tshangs pa thams cad kyi sgra dang skad thams cad so sor rtog cing mkhyen pa ni sgra ji bzhin shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang ; lha dang / mi dang / tshangs pa thams cad kyi sgra dang skad thams cad so sor rtog cing mkhyen pa ni sgra ji bzhin shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase knowing the words as they are means that by knowing the words as they are, the Bodhisattva understands and knows all the words and voices of all the hell-beings, animals, hungry ghosts, gods, men, and Brahma gods.

original: thams cad la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya bar sbyar bas dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis sgom par byed ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya bar sbyar bas dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis sgom par byed ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase in all of them, abiding in the perfection of wisdom should be applied to all [the perfections]. It should be understood that the phrase one should meditate by the method of nonapprehension is to be applied to all [the perfections].

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi bsgom pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi bsgom pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase one should perfect the samadhi that is accompanied by conceptualization and discernment and so forth indicates the cultivation of the four meditations of the form realm.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po de dag kyang don dam par dmigs su med par rtogs nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po de dag kyang don dam par dmigs su med par rtogs nas /
translated: Having realized that those four meditations ultimately cannot be objectified,

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don du bsgom ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pa'i dbang gis sems can gyi don du bsgom ste /
translated: one cultivates them conventionally for the sake of sentient beings through the power of skillful means.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: In the first meditation, there is conceptualization and discernment.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni rnam par rtog pa med cing /

analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is natural patience?

original: gang rang bzhin gyis mi 'khrugs pa /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis mi 'khrugs pa /
translated: It is not being disturbed by nature.

original: sha mi ldon pa dang / zhe la mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sha mi ldon pa dang / zhe la mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is not bearing a grudge.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' la gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la /
translated: What is the patience of accepting suffering?

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar 'du shes skyed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar 'du shes skyed de /
translated: The bodhisattva who is practicing the Great Way should think like this:

original: 'di dag ni rkyen la rag lus pa 'du byed tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rkyen la rag lus pa 'du byed tsam du zad de /
translated: ‚ÄúThese sentient beings who are harming me are under the influence of causes and conditions, and are mere compounded things.

original: 'di la bdag gam /
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam /
translated: There is no self here,

original: sems can nam /üîΩsrog gam / skye ba gang gshe pa'am /
analyzed: sems can nam / srog gam / skye ba gang gshe pa'am /
translated: no sentient being,üîΩno life-force, and no person who is being abused,

original: khro ba'am / rdeg pa'am /
analyzed: khro ba'am / rdeg pa'am /
translated: who is getting angry, who is beating, or who is exposing.

original: mtshang 'bru ba gang yang med do snyam du sems shing sems can du 'du shes pa med de chos tsam du gnas so //
analyzed: mtshang 'bru ba gang yang med do snyam du sems shing sems can du 'du shes pa med de chos tsam du gnas so //
translated: ‚Äù In this way, the bodhisattva does not conceive of sentient beings, but remains in the mere idea of dharmas.

original: de chos tsam gyi 'du shes de la gnas nas /
analyzed: de chos tsam gyi 'du shes de la gnas nas /
translated: And remaining in that mere idea of dharmas,

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam zhing bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam zhing bzod pa'o //
translated: he or she endures the harm done by others without getting angry.

original: de la sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the patience of experiencing suffering?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar slob ste /üîΩbdag sngon 'dod pa'i longs spyod tshol ba na sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i 'dod pa rnams kyi don du /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar slob ste / bdag sngon 'dod pa'i longs spyod tshol ba na sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i 'dod pa rnams kyi don du /
translated: Here a bodhisattva trains as follows:

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po myong zhing nyams su blangs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa mang po myong zhing nyams su blangs te /
translated: When I was previously seeking out the enjoyments of desire, I experienced and underwent many kinds of suffering for the sake of the desires that are the causes of suffering.üîΩI experienced and underwent that suffering without knowing that it was meaningless.

original: zhing rmo ba dang / tshong bya ba dang / rgyal srid bya ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ni mi shes pa'i dbang gis don med par myong gi / de ni bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'i dge ba spyod pa la sngon gyi sdug bsngal bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma bas lhag pa'i sdug bsngalüîΩnyams su blangs pa yang rigs na /
analyzed: zhing rmo ba dang / tshong bya ba dang / rgyal srid bya ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ni mi shes pa'i dbang gis don med par myong gi / de ni bde ba thob par 'gyur ba'i dge ba spyod pa la sngon gyi sdug bsngal bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma bas lhag pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su blangs pa yang rigs na /
translated: If it is right for me to undergo suffering that is greater than the many trillions of sufferings I have previously experienced in order to obtain happiness by engaging in virtuous actions,üîΩthen what need is there to mention that it is right for me to undergo a small amount of suffering?

original: de las chung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam du de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed cing /
analyzed: de las chung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam du de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed cing /
translated: In this way, he properly brings this to mind.

original: byang chub thob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su len pa'i bzod pa'o //üîΩchos la nges par @38a * //
analyzed: byang chub thob par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su len pa'i bzod pa'o // chos la nges par @38a * //
translated: The patience of the bodhisattva who is attaining enlightenment is the patience of accepting all suffering.

original: mos pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /üîΩ'di la byang chub sems dpa' chos yang dag par shes shing len par spyad pa'i blas dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / yang dag pa nyid kyi don dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu chen po dang ; rgyu dang /
analyzed: mos pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chos yang dag par shes shing len par spyad pa'i blas dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / yang dag pa nyid kyi don dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu chen po dang ; rgyu dang /
translated: What is the patience of conviction in the Dharma?üîΩHere the bodhisattva, with a mind that is well-practiced in the understanding and acceptance of the Dharma, has long been accustomed to the domain of knowledge, which is the virtues of the Three Jewels, the meaning of reality, the great power of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, cause and effect, the meaning of what is to be attained, the means of attaining it, and the means of purifying the path.

original: 'bras bu dang / thob par bya ba'i don dang / bdag gis de thob par bya ba'i thabs dang / shes par bya ba'i spyod yul la yun ring por goms par byas pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes yang dag par grub par byas pas mos pa rab tu zhen pa'o ;
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / thob par bya ba'i don dang / bdag gis de thob par bya ba'i thabs dang / shes par bya ba'i spyod yul la yun ring por goms par byas pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes yang dag par grub par byas pas mos pa rab tu zhen pa'o ;
translated: He has a conviction that is well-established by the accomplishment of very pure knowledge.

original: / bya dka' ba la bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: / bya dka' ba la bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the patience of difficulty?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can dman zhing kha nyen pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa la bzod pa dang / rje dpon du gyur pa la bdag nyid kyis bzod pa dang / rigs dang rus kyis rab tu dman par gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyis gnod pa chen po byas pa la bzod pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems can dman zhing kha nyen pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa la bzod pa dang / rje dpon du gyur pa la bdag nyid kyis bzod pa dang / rigs dang rus kyis rab tu dman par gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyis gnod pa chen po byas pa la bzod pa dang gsum mo //
translated: Here, the patience of the bodhisattva is threefold: patience with regard to the harm done by inferior and weak beings; patience with regard to the harm done by one‚Äôs own self as a master; and patience with regard to the great harm done by beings who are of low caste and family.

original: thams cad kyi sgo'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is patience as a door to everything?

original: de la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is fourfold:

original: 'di la yang byang chub sems dpa' mdza' bshes dang / mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal pas gnod par byas pa la bzod pa dang / de gsum bdag pas dma' ba dang / bdag dang mtshungs pa dang / bdag pas lhag pas gnod par byas pa la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang byang chub sems dpa' mdza' bshes dang / mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal pas gnod par byas pa la bzod pa dang / de gsum bdag pas dma' ba dang / bdag dang mtshungs pa dang / bdag pas lhag pas gnod par byas pa la bzod pa'o //
translated: Here, the bodhisattva is patient with regard to the harm done by friends, foes, and neutral persons; and he is patient with regard to the harm done by those who are inferior, equal, or superior to himself.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is patience as a good person?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: It is fivefold:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po nas bzod pa la phan yon du lta ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa'i mi la phyis dgra mang du mi 'gyur ba dang / dbyen byed pa mang du mi 'gyur ba dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba mang du 'gyur ba dang /üîΩ'gyod pa med par tshe 'pho ba'i dus byed cing lus zhig ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po nas bzod pa la phan yon du lta ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa'i mi la phyis dgra mang du mi 'gyur ba dang / dbyen byed pa mang du mi 'gyur ba dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba mang du 'gyur ba dang / 'gyod pa med par tshe 'pho ba'i dus byed cing lus zhig ste /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva from the very beginning views patience as beneficial, and later on, he or she does not become a person who has many enemies, does not become a person who has many divisive friends, and becomes a person who has much happiness and mental pleasure.

original: tshe 'phos nas kyang mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'phos nas kyang mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He or she dies without regret, and after death, is reborn in a high status among the gods in the celestial worlds.

original: de de ltar bzod pa la phan yon du lta bas bdag kyang bzod la /
analyzed: de de ltar bzod pa la phan yon du lta bas bdag kyang bzod la /
translated: In this way, by viewing patience as beneficial, he or she becomes patient him or herself,

original: gzhan yang bzod pa la bskul ba dang / bzod pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag mthong na yid dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bzod pa la bskul ba dang / bzod pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag mthong na yid dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: encourages others to be patient, speaks in praise of patience, and is pleased upon seeing a person who is patient.

original: @38b de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad du bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: @38b de la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam pa thams cad du bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: In this chapter on patience, what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô patience in all its forms?

original: rnam pa bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gsum ste /
translated: It is of thirteen kinds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi bzod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dod pa myong bas 'jigs pa'i phyir bzod pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje ba dang / byams pa'i bzod pa dang ; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab tu 'dod pas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa dang /üîΩrab tu byung bas bzod pa bya bar rigs pas bzod pa bya ba'i yi dam bcas pa'i phyir bzod pa dang / sngon bzod pa bsgoms bsgoms pas ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi bzod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dod pa myong bas 'jigs pa'i phyir bzod pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje ba dang / byams pa'i bzod pa dang ; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rab tu 'dod pas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa dang / rab tu byung bas bzod pa bya bar rigs pas bzod pa bya ba'i yi dam bcas pa'i phyir bzod pa dang / sngon bzod pa bsgoms bsgoms pas ;
translated: Bodhisattvas have patience because they are afraid of experiencing the undesirable results of impatience, because they have compassion for sentient beings, because they have the patience of love and because they want to complete the transcendent patience of unsurpassable perfect enlightenment.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis bzod pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med par rig nas brjod du med cing chos nyid tsam du rtogs pas chos la nges pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa thams cad bzod pa dang /
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis bzod pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med par rig nas brjod du med cing chos nyid tsam du rtogs pas chos la nges pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod pa thams cad bzod pa dang /
translated: They have patience because it is right for ordained people to be patient and they have taken a vow to be patient, because they have cultivated patience in the past and so are naturally patient and because they have realized that all phenomena are devoid of self and are therefore inexpressible and are simply the nature of phenomena and so have the patience of certainty in the teachings.

original: thams cad la bzod pa dang ; dben pa'am mi mang po'i nang du yang rung ste /
analyzed: thams cad la bzod pa dang ; dben pa'am mi mang po'i nang du yang rung ste /
translated: patience with regard to all, patience in solitude or in the midst of many people,

original: yul thams cad la bzod pa dang / snga dro dang / nyi ma gung dang / phyi dro dang / nyin par dang / mtshan mo dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / na ba'i tshe dang /
analyzed: yul thams cad la bzod pa dang / snga dro dang / nyi ma gung dang / phyi dro dang / nyin par dang / mtshan mo dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / na ba'i tshe dang /
translated: patience with regard to all objects, patience in the morning, at noon, and in the evening, patience by day and by night, patience with regard to the past, future, and present, patience when sick,

original: min pa'i tshe dang / dar ba dang / rgud pa'i dus thams cad du bzod pa dang / lus kyis mi rtog par bzod pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig mi bzod par dag gi bzod pa dang / mi 'khrug cing bsam pa ngan pa med par yid kyis bzod pa dang bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: min pa'i tshe dang / dar ba dang / rgud pa'i dus thams cad du bzod pa dang / lus kyis mi rtog par bzod pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshig mi bzod par dag gi bzod pa dang / mi 'khrug cing bsam pa ngan pa med par yid kyis bzod pa dang bcu gsum mo //
translated: patience when not sick, patience in all situations, whether of prosperity or of decline, patience with the body, patience with disagreeable words, and patience with the mind, without agitation or evil thoughts.

original: de la phongs pa 'dod pa la bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phongs pa 'dod pa la bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is patience with regard to the distressed and what they want?

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is fourfold:

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams slong mi mkhas par slong ba'i nyes pa la bzod pa dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal med par bya bar rtsol ba la bzod pa dang / sems can chos tshol zhing chos kyi rjes su sgrub pa rnams la chos ston par brtson pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams slong mi mkhas par slong ba'i nyes pa la bzod pa dang / sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal med par bya bar rtsol ba la bzod pa dang / sems can chos tshol zhing chos kyi rjes su sgrub pa rnams la chos ston par brtson pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: patience in not being skilled in the methods of helping suffering sentient beings; patience in striving to eliminate the suffering of suffering sentient beings; patience in teaching the Dharma to sentient beings who seek the Dharma and practice in accordance with the Dharma;

original: sems can brel ba'i grogs byed pa la 'bad pa'i bzod pa dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: sems can brel ba'i grogs byed pa la 'bad pa'i bzod pa dang bzhi'o //
translated: and patience in striving to help busy sentient beings.

original: 'di dang gzhan du sdug bsngal ba'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du sdug bsngal ba'i bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is patience with regard to suffering in this and other lives?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bag yod par gnas shing @39a * //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bag yod par gnas shing @39a * //
translated: Here, bodhisattvas, while remaining heedful

original: dge ba spyod pa na /
analyzed: dge ba spyod pa na /
translated: and practicing virtue,

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang ma dang / sdig sbrul la sogs pa'i gnod pa bzod pa dang / lus dang sems ngal ba bzod pa dang / sems can la snying brtse ba'i phyir 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe /
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang ma dang / sdig sbrul la sogs pa'i gnod pa bzod pa dang / lus dang sems ngal ba bzod pa dang / sems can la snying brtse ba'i phyir 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe /
translated: It is to have patience with cold, heat, hunger, thirst, flies, mosquitoes, snakes, and so forth. It is to have patience with the fatigue of body and mind. It is to have patience with sentient beings out of love for them.üîΩ

original: skye ba dang ; rga ba dang / na ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bzod pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang ; rga ba dang / na ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bzod pa'o //
translated: It is the patience of enduring cold, heat, hunger, thirst, flies, mosquitoes, snakes, and so on; the patience of enduring physical and mental fatigue; and the patience of enduring birth, old age, sickness, and so on, while revolving in cyclic existence out of love for sentient beings.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa nyi shu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos la dad pa dang / shes rab kyis rtogs pa'i rgyus sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / nges par khong du chud pa'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa nyi shu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos la dad pa dang / shes rab kyis rtogs pa'i rgyus sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa dang / rtogs pa dang / nges par khong du chud pa'i bsam pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should perfect the twenty kinds of superior attitude.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: The superior attitude of the bodhisattva is the aspiration to the qualities of buddhahood, the interest in the qualities of buddhahood, and the certainty of understanding that comes from the cause, which is the bodhisattva‚Äôs faith in and realization of the qualities of buddhahood through wisdom.

original: de yang rnam pa nyi shu'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa nyi shu'o //
translated: This is also of twenty kinds.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la lhag par dad cing sems pa mchog gi bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blang ba la lhag par sems pa'i tshul khrims kyi bsam pa dang / sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la lhag par dad cing sems pa mchog gi bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blang ba la lhag par sems pa'i tshul khrims kyi bsam pa dang / sbyin pa dang /
translated: The intention of supreme thought is to have supreme faith and interest in the Buddha, Dharma and Sangha. The intention of the moral discipline of the paramitas is to have supreme interest in taking up the vows of the bodhisattva discipline. The intention of the paramitas is to have supreme interest in accomplishing generosity,

original: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yang dag par grub par bya ba'i phyir lhag par sems pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa dang / chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa dang / don dam pa dang chos kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo la lhag par sems pa yang dag pa'i don gyi bsam pa dang /
analyzed: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab yang dag par grub par bya ba'i phyir lhag par sems pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa dang / chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa dang / don dam pa dang chos kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo la lhag par sems pa yang dag pa'i don gyi bsam pa dang /
translated: patience, effort, concentration and wisdom. The intention of the true meaning is to have supreme interest in the selflessness of phenomena and of persons and in the profound suchness of reality and of phenomena.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems rtse gcig tu nges par gyur cing mi 'gyur ba brtan pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la lhag pa'i bsam pa ma dag pa'i bsam pa dang / sa dang po nas sa brgyad pa'i bar gyi lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems rtse gcig tu nges par gyur cing mi 'gyur ba brtan pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa la lhag pa'i bsam pa ma dag pa'i bsam pa dang / sa dang po nas sa brgyad pa'i bar gyi lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa dang /
translated: From the first to the eighth level, their intention is pure.üîΩOn the ninth and tenth levels, their intention is extremely pure.üîΩThey have the intention of being superior to the buddhas and bodhisattvas with their inconceivable powers of preternatural knowledge.

original: mthar phyin pa'i sa ste sa dgu pa dang / bcu pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu dag pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthu la lhag par sems pa dang / sems can rnams dge ba byed du 'jug pa phan pa'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i sa ste sa dgu pa dang / bcu pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu dag pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthu la lhag par sems pa dang / sems can rnams dge ba byed du 'jug pa phan pa'i bsam pa dang /
translated: They have the intention to benefit, that is, to make sentient beings practice virtue.

original: bla ma dang sbyin gnas la mi slu ba'i bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chos @39b mthun par spyod pa dang / 'grogs na bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las thams cad zil gyis mnan pa dag gi sems kyi dbang du gyur par bya ba'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: bla ma dang sbyin gnas la mi slu ba'i bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chos @39b mthun par spyod pa dang / 'grogs na bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las thams cad zil gyis mnan pa dag gi sems kyi dbang du gyur par bya ba'i bsam pa dang /
translated: the thought of never deceiving one‚Äôs guru or one‚Äôs benefactor; the thought of practicing the Dharma in accord with the bodhisattvas; the thought of making oneself easy to live with; the thought of being in control of one‚Äôs mind, having overcome all the mental afflictions, the secondary mental afflictions, and the activities of MƒÅra;

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The aspiration to perfect the knowledge of a Omniscient One refers to the three kinds of knowledge of an Omniscient One:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //

translated: the knowledge of a Sravaka or Pratyekabuddha Omniscient One, the knowledge of the aspects of the path of the Bodhisattvas, and the knowledge of all aspects of the Tathagatas.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong shes pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la zhi gnas ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong shes pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba la zhi gnas ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa'o //
translated: Serenity is the one-pointed abiding of the mind in non-discursiveness while cultivating the concentration on emptiness.

original: lhag mthong ni de ltar sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa las bying zhing rmugs par mi 'gyur bar shes rab kyis gsal bar byas te /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni de ltar sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa las bying zhing rmugs par mi 'gyur bar shes rab kyis gsal bar byas te /
translated: Insight is the illumination of that one-pointed abiding of the mind by wisdom, without sinking into laxity and torpor.

original: yang dag pa'i don lhag par mthong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don lhag par mthong bar byed pa'o //

original: rig pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rig pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should perfect the three knowledges.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i rig pa dang / tshe 'pho ba dang skye bshes pa'i rig pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i reg pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i rig pa dang / tshe 'pho ba dang skye bshes pa'i rig pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i reg pa dang gsum mo //
translated: The three knowledges are the knowledge of recollecting past lives, the knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings, and the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang /üîΩspobs pa so so yang dag par rig @40a * //

translated: The four right discriminations are the right discrimination of the teaching, the right discrimination of meaning, the right discrimination of clear expression, and the right discrimination of confidence.

original: pa ste ; de la chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa zhal nas gsungs pa'i lung gi chos rnams yang dag par rig pa'o //üîΩdon so so yang dag par rig pa ni lung gi chos de rnams kyi don yang dag pa gang yin pa rig pa'o //

translated: The right discrimination of the teaching is the knowledge of the scriptural teachings, the words of the Buddha, such as the Sutras.üîΩThe right discrimination of meaning is the knowledge of the meaning of those scriptural teachings.

original: des pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
analyzed: des pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni /

original: byang chub sems dpa' lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa sems can yin no cog gis smras pa'i skad brda phrad cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa sems can yin no cog gis smras pa'i skad brda phrad cing /

analyzed: sems can yin no cog gi skad du gsung zhing chos ston pa'o //
translated: He speaks in the language of each being and teaches the Dharma.üîΩThe right discrimination of confidence is the knowledge of the various kinds of eloquence.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spobs pa sus kyang zil gyis mi non pa ste /
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spobs pa sus kyang zil gyis mi non pa ste /
translated: Correct understanding of eloquence is the bodhisattva's eloquence which is not overwhelmed by anyone.

original: gzhan la chos 'dri ba'i spobs pa thogs pa med pa dang / gzhan gyis dris pa'i lan 'debs pa la spobs pa thogs pa med pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩmi 'jigs pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i chos nges par bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa dang /

analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i lam bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa ste /
translated: One should complete the four forms of fearlessness means the fearlessness of manifest enlightenment, the fearlessness of the destruction of defilements, the fearlessness of teaching the factors that are obstacles, and the fearlessness of teaching the path of definite emergence.

analyzed: de la mngon par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa ni /

original: lha 'am / bdud dam /
analyzed: lha 'am / bdud dam /
translated: No god, demon,

translated: Brahma, ascetic, or Brahmin, or anyone else endowed with power, miracles, and qualities, or anyone else who is conceited with wisdom,üîΩcan find any basis or reason to dispute that the Tathagata is not fully enlightened.

analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya'o // zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa ni /
translated: Since there is no fear of being disputed, it is called fearlessness with regard to perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i zag pa rnams bag chags yan chad spangs te /

analyzed: mi 'jigs shing mi dogs pa'o ;

analyzed: / nges par 'byung ba'i lam bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa ni /
translated: Fearlessness in teaching the path of definite emergenceüîΩ.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nges par 'byung ba'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin par bshad pa la /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug sngar yang bshad mod kyi /

translated: The seven riches are to be perfected means

original: nam zhig sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad sel nus snyam du rnam par rtog pa dang / nam zhig dbul bas sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams 'byor pa chen po la 'jog nus snyam du rnam par rtog pa dang / nam zhig sha khrag dang bcas pa'i lus kyis sems can rnams kyi don byed nus snyam du rnam par rtog pa dang /

translated: Even if I have to remain in the hells for a long time,üîΩwhen will I be able to benefit sentient beings?

translated: and When will I see the fulfillment of the hopes of all worlds through the wealth of the world transcending ones?üîΩ and When will I become a Buddha and liberate all sentient beings from all the sufferings of cyclic existence?

original: sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i skye ba dang / sems can gyi don du sbyor ba med pa'i sems dang / don dam pa'i ro gcig pu la spyod pa dang / skye bo thams cad sim par byed pa ma yin pa'i tshig dang ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i skye ba dang / sems can gyi don du sbyor ba med pa'i sems dang / don dam pa'i ro gcig pu la spyod pa dang / skye bo thams cad sim par byed pa ma yin pa'i tshig dang ;
translated: and When will I be born without being able to benefit all sentient beings, have a mind that does not apply itself to the welfare of sentient beings, engage in the single taste of the ultimate and have words that do not soothe all beings?

analyzed: gzhan la mi phan pa'i 'tsho ba dang / gzhan la phan pa byed mi nus pa'i lus dang / gzhan la phan 'dogs pa la mi gsal ba'i blo dang / sems can la phan par mi spyod pa'i nor dang / 'gro ba rnams kyi don spyod pa med pa'i dbang phyug dang /
translated: a life that does not benefit others, a body that is unable to help others, a mind that is not clear about helping others, wealth that is not used to help sentient beings, and a sovereignty that does not benefit beings.üîΩ‚ÄúMay I never delight in harming others in any of my lives.‚Äù

analyzed: bdag gis legs par spyad pa'i 'bras bu thams cad sems can thams cad la smin par gyur cig snyam du rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: May the results of all my good actions ripen upon all living beings.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni skyes bu chen po'i rnam par rtog pa brgyad do //
translated: These are the eight thoughts of a great being.

original: sems can gyi gnas dgu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa na rnam par rtog pa de dag 'bras bu yod par bya ba dang / snying rjes 'jig rten pa rnams la bltas nas /üîΩgzhan la phan pa bsgrub par bya ba dang / shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa yid la byed pa bsgom par bya ba dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi gnas dgu yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa na rnam par rtog pa de dag 'bras bu yod par bya ba dang / snying rjes 'jig rten pa rnams la bltas nas / gzhan la phan pa bsgrub par bya ba dang / shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa yid la byed pa bsgom par bya ba dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: When one reflects in this way, these reflections have a purpose, for one sees the world with compassion and

original: sems can gyi gnas dgu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi gnas dgu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one accomplishes the benefit of others, one cultivates the mental attention of the nondiscernment of wisdom, and one cultivates the nine abodes of sentient beings in order to investigate the world of sentient beings and the world of their containers.

analyzed: sems can gyi gnas dgu po de dag kyang gang zhe na /

analyzed: lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag dper na mi rnams dang lha kha cig go //
