translated: and to be accepted by the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su bsgrub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su bsgrub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The meaning of if one wishes to attain the Buddha's body and so on is as follows:

original: sa brgyad pa'i yon tan rnam par dag pa rnams thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa bstan te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i yon tan rnam par dag pa rnams thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa bstan te /
translated: The intention to attain the pure qualities of the eighth ground is taught.

original: de la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i 'og nas 'chad pas 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: de la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i 'og nas 'chad pas 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: The thirty-two marks of the superman and the eighty minor characteristics will be explained later, so they are not explained here.

original: tshe rabs dran par 'dod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi stor ba thob par 'dod pa la sogs pa go sla ba rnams kyang ma bshad do//
analyzed: tshe rabs dran par 'dod pa dang / byang chub kyi sems mi stor ba thob par 'dod pa la sogs pa go sla ba rnams kyang ma bshad do//
translated: The easy ones, such as the desire to remember one‚Äôs past lives and the desire to attain the non-loss of the Thought of Enlightenment, are not explained.

original: de la bshad dgos pa rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad dgos pa rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, those that need to be explained will be explained.

original: dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gcig 'ga' yang snying po byang chub la nam 'dug gi bar du mi zad par bya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni chu'i thigs pa gcig rgya mtsho'i nang du blugs pa zad par mi 'gyur pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gcig 'ga' yang snying po byang chub la nam 'dug gi bar du mi zad par bya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni chu'i thigs pa gcig rgya mtsho'i nang du blugs pa zad par mi 'gyur pa bzhin du /
translated: ‚Äú The desire to make even a single generation of the Thought of Virtue not wasted until one sits on the diamond throne‚Äù is like a single drop of water poured into the ocean not being wasted.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa yang 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa yang 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dedication to the knowledge of all aspects is also said to be ‚Äúnot wasted‚Äù because it works for the welfare of sentient beings until the end of cyclic existence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi skye ba rgyun mi gcad pa'i don du gnas par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi skye ba rgyun mi gcad pa'i don du gnas par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because he wishes to abide in order to not cut off the births of the buddhas.

original: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa yin pas /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa yin pas /
translated: Because the bodhisattva who abides on the eighth level is irreversible,

original: sangs rgyas skye ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas skye ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the births of the buddhas are not cut off.üîΩBecause he wishes to protect the lineage of the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yongs su bsrung 'dod pas zhes bya ba yang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yin pas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs las mi nyams par srung bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yongs su bsrung 'dod pas zhes bya ba yang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yin pas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs las mi nyams par srung bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he abides on the eighth level, because he does not fall from the lineage of the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi gcad pa'i don du gnas par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi gcad pa'i don du gnas par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because he wishes to abide in order to not cut off the lineage of the buddhas,

original: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su nges par lung bstan pa yin pas na /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su nges par lung bstan pa yin pas na /
translated: the bodhisattva who abides on the eighth level is definitely prophesied as a buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: and so the lineage of the buddhas is not cut off.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @45b 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @45b 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, even those who wish to maintain the lineage of the buddhas should train in this perfection of wisdom.üîΩThose who wish to stand in the emptiness of internal phenomena should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni nang gi chos mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams te /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni nang gi chos mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams te /
translated: The internal phenomena are the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de la mig mig gis stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la mig mig gis stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the eyes by way of the eyes, and so on, is the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: phyi stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The emptiness of external phenomena is

original: phyi'i chos gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya chos rnams te /
analyzed: phyi'i chos gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya chos rnams te /
translated: the external phenomena of form, sound, smell, taste, tactility, and mental phenomena.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩphyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug rnams ni phyi nang gi chos yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o // phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug rnams ni phyi nang gi chos yin te /
translated: Form is empty of form, and so on.üîΩThe emptiness of internal and external phenomena is the six internal sense spheres and the six external sense spheres.

original: de la nang gi chos rnams ni phyi'i chos rnams kyis stong /
analyzed: de la nang gi chos rnams ni phyi'i chos rnams kyis stong /
translated: The internal phenomena are empty of the external phenomena.

original: phyi'i chos rnams kyang nang gi chos rnams kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams kyang nang gi chos rnams kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: External phenomena are empty of internal phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid de yang yod pa ma yin te stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid de yang yod pa ma yin te stong pa'i phyir /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness means that the emptiness of all phenomena does not exist, because it is empty.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o//üîΩchen po stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni shar gyi phyogs shar gyi phyogs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o// chen po stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni shar gyi phyogs shar gyi phyogs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is called the emptiness of emptiness.üîΩThe emptiness of the great means that the eastern direction is empty of the eastern direction, and so on up to:

original: steng gi phyogs steng gi phyogs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten chen po stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o //üîΩdon dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: steng gi phyogs steng gi phyogs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten chen po stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o // don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The upper direction is empty of the upper direction. This is the emptiness of the great, the container world.

original: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate means that the ultimate is nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang don dam par yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang don dam par yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Nirvana does not exist in the ultimate,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: because it is empty of the very nature of nirvana.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi chos rnams te /
translated: The conditioned is the phenomena of the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: de dag kyang 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And those are also the desire realm is empty of the desire realm, and so on.

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni gang la skye ba yang med /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni gang la skye ba yang med /
translated: The unconditioned is that which has no arising,

original: 'gag pa yang med /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang med /
translated: no cessation,

original: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med pa ste /üîΩde la 'dus ma byas pa yang 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med pa ste / de la 'dus ma byas pa yang 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and no abiding.üîΩAnd the unconditioned is empty of the unconditioned.üîΩThe emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems can la sogs pa dngos pa gang gis mtha' dmigs su med pa de la mtha' las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems can la sogs pa dngos pa gang gis mtha' dmigs su med pa de la mtha' las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is beyond extremes is called ‚Äúbeyond extremes‚Äù because it is not observed as an extreme in any way, such as in terms of sentient beings.

original: @46a * // mtha' las 'das pa nyid mtha' las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: @46a * // mtha' las 'das pa nyid mtha' las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The transcendence of the extremes is empty of the nature of the transcendence of the extremes.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'khor ba la sogs pa dngos po gang gis thog ma 'ong ba dang / tha ma 'gro ba dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'khor ba la sogs pa dngos po gang gis thog ma 'ong ba dang / tha ma 'gro ba dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: Emptiness of beginningless and endless means that the beginning and end of any entity such as samsara are not observed.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The beginningless and endless is empty of the beginningless and endless.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe na yang dge ba mi zad par bya ba'i phyir dor ba gang yang med pa ste /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe na yang dge ba mi zad par bya ba'i phyir dor ba gang yang med pa ste /
translated: Emptiness of nonrejection means that even when one attains the nirvana that is not a static extreme, there is nothing whatsoever to reject in order to make virtue inexhaustible.

original: dor ba med pa nyid dor ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: dor ba med pa nyid dor ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: Nonrejection is empty of the nature of nonrejection.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni /
translated: Emptiness of nature means that the nature of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gang gis kyang ma byas te rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gang gis kyang ma byas te rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o //
translated: the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas, or the tathƒÅgatas.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: All phenomena are empty.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, the form realm, the formless realm, the conditioned, the unconditioned, and so forth.

original: chos de dag thams cad chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: All those phenomena are empty of the intrinsic nature of all phenomena.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su yod pa /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba la gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su yod pa /
translated: The emptiness of defining characteristics. The defining characteristic of form is to be able to assume shapes.

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong ba /
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong ba /
translated: The defining characteristic of feeling is to experience pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa /
translated: The defining characteristic of perception is to apprehend characteristics.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni bye brag tu rnam par phye ste shes pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni bye brag tu rnam par phye ste shes pa /
translated: The characteristic of consciousness is to cognize specifically.

original: phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal ba /
translated: The characteristic of the aggregates is suffering.

original: khams kyi mtshan nyid ni myur ba'i dug dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: khams kyi mtshan nyid ni myur ba'i dug dang 'dra ba /
translated: The characteristic of the elements is like a swift poison.

original: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the sense-spheres is the door for the arising of consciousness. The emptiness of the intrinsic identity of all phenomena is the emptiness of the intrinsic identity.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni /üîΩgang 'das pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni / gang 'das pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is as follows:üîΩThe past is not apprehended.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: The future is not apprehended.

original: da ltar @46b byung ba yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: da ltar @46b byung ba yang mi dmigs te /
translated: The present is not apprehended.

original: mi dmigs pa de nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de nyid mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of the intrinsic identity of that non-apprehension is the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad mi dmigs te /
translated: The emptiness of the non-existence of things is as follows: In that way, all phenomena are not apprehended.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin yod snyam du sems pa las bzlog pa'i phyir dngos po med pa de yang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin yod snyam du sems pa las bzlog pa'i phyir dngos po med pa de yang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThat non-entity is empty of the entityness of non-entity‚Äù is to counter the idea that the nature of that non-entity exists.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba la /üîΩngo bo nyid ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid de dag dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba la / ngo bo nyid ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid de dag dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang /
translated: Emptiness of essential nature.üîΩEssential nature refers to the essential nature of self and the essential nature of other.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of those, which are called the essential nature of self and the essential nature of other, is the emptiness of essential nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dngos po med pa'o zhes bshad pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yod snyam du rnam par rtog pa skye ba las bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dngos po med pa'o zhes bshad pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yod snyam du rnam par rtog pa skye ba las bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities‚Äù is made to counter the idea that the essential nature of nonentities exists, where nonentities are explained as conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te stong pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nature of non-entity does not exist, because it is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid de lta bu la gnas par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid de lta bu la gnas par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to stand in such emptiness should train in the perfection of wisdom. This should be applied to all.

original: stong pa nyid 'di rnams kyang rang bzhin ni gcig tu zad pa las /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di rnams kyang rang bzhin ni gcig tu zad pa las /
translated: These emptinesses are all of one nature,

original: bye brag tu phye ba ste bco brgyad du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu phye ba ste bco brgyad du bshad pa ni /
translated: but they are distinguished as eighteen.

original: phyi nang gi dngos po rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pa las bzlog pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i sems dang / yid la byed pa'i khyad par las sgro btags te rnam pa bco brgyad du bshad do //
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pa las bzlog pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'i sems dang / yid la byed pa'i khyad par las sgro btags te rnam pa bco brgyad du bshad do //
translated: The eighteen are explained as a reversal of the apprehension of signs in external and internal things, and as a superimposition from the special mental activity of the yogi's mind.

original: dmigs pa dang / dbang dang / de ma thag pa dang / rgyu'i rkyen khong du chud par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rkyen bzhi rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / dbang dang / de ma thag pa dang / rgyu'i rkyen khong du chud par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rkyen bzhi rtogs par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: One who wishes to understand the objective condition, the dominant condition, the immediate condition, and the causal condition, means one who wishes to realize the four conditions.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen bzhi la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rkyen bzhi la /
translated: The four conditions for the arising of consciousness are:

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul drug ni dmigs pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul drug ni dmigs pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The six objects such as form are the objective condition.

original: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dbang po drug ni dbang gi rkyen to //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dbang po drug ni dbang gi rkyen to //
translated: The six sense faculties such as the eye are the dominant condition.

original: rnam par shes pa drug 'das pa'i de ma thag pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug 'das pa'i de ma thag pa ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The immediately past six consciousnesses are the immediately preceding condition.

translated: The conditioned is that which is produced by the assembly and combination of causes and conditions.

original: de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is also with outflows and without outflows.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa ni /
translated: The conditioned with outflows

original: khams gsum du gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum du gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: are the phenomena belonging to the three realms.

original: zag pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The conditioned without outflows is the nature of the noble path.

original: chos de dag kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i tshul du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ni /
analyzed: chos de dag kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i tshul du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ni /
translated: The correct knowledge of all these phenomena in the manner of the relative and the ultimate is

original: mthar phyin cing chub pa yin pas pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin cing chub pa yin pas pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the perfection because it is the completion and fulfillment.

original: chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba la zag pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba la zag pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The dharmas with outflows and without outflows. Those with outflows are form, etc.

original: gang la nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba rnams so //
analyzed: gang la nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba rnams so //
translated: They are the bases for the arising of the defilements.

original: zag pa med pa ni sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those without outflows are the stages, perfections, nirvana, etc.

original: gang la nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang la nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are the bases for the non-arising of the defilements.

original: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa ni snga ma bzhin no //üîΩchos dge ba dang mi @49a * //
analyzed: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa ni snga ma bzhin no // chos dge ba dang mi @49a * //
translated: Their perfection is as before.

original: dge ba rnams zhes bya ba la dge ba ni 'dod chags med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba rnams zhes bya ba la dge ba ni 'dod chags med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dharmas that are wholesome and unwholesome. Wholesome means without greed, without hatred, without delusion, etc.

original: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'o //
translated: Unwholesome means with greed, with hatred, etc.

original: chos 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnams zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa man chad ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnams zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa man chad ni 'jig rten pa'i chos so //
translated: The dharmas that are mundane and supramundane. Those on the stage of action in faith and below are mundane dharmas.

original: sa dang po yan chad sangs rgyas kyi sa la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad sangs rgyas kyi sa la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The supramundane dharmas are from the first stage up to the stage of the Buddha.

original: chos gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The dharmas with form and without form.

original: gzugs yod pa la ni bltar snang zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs yod pa la ni bltar snang zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The dharmas with form are visible, resistant.

original: gzugs med pa ni bltar mi snang la thogs pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni bltar mi snang la thogs pa med pa rnams so //
translated: The dharmas without form are invisible and non-resistant.üîΩThe dharmas with retribution and without retribution.

original: chos lung bstan du yod pa dang / lung bstan du med pa rnams zhes bya ba la lung bstan du yod pa ni 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa spyad pa'i rgyus mtho ris dang longs spyod chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung bstan du rung ba rnams so //
analyzed: chos lung bstan du yod pa dang / lung bstan du med pa rnams zhes bya ba la lung bstan du yod pa ni 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa spyad pa'i rgyus mtho ris dang longs spyod chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung bstan du rung ba rnams so //
translated: The dharmas with retribution are the dharmas which are the cause of the acquisition of heaven and of great enjoyment, by reason of the practice of generosity, morality, etc. with a mind free from attachment, aversion and error. They are so called because they can be indicated as the cause of retribution.

original: lung bstan du med pa ni bzo'i gnas dang rol mo la sogs pa spyad pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gang du yang 'gyur bar nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan du med pa ni bzo'i gnas dang rol mo la sogs pa spyad pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gang du yang 'gyur bar nges pa med pa'o //
translated: The indeterminate is the result of the practice of arts and crafts, music, etc., which is not certain to be either pleasant or painful.

original: chos nges pa dang ma nges pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos nges pa dang ma nges pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Dharma is said to be definite and indefinite.

original: nges pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ris su nges pa rnams so //
analyzed: nges pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ris su nges pa rnams so //
translated: The definite is that of the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Bodhisattvas.

original: ma nges pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / sdig pa'i grogs po'i khar las pa rnams so //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / sdig pa'i grogs po'i khar las pa rnams so //
translated: The indefinite is that of those who are influenced by a spiritual teacher or by a bad friend.

original: chos 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Dharma is said to be that which arises and that which does not arise.

original: 'byung ba ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba'i rang bzhin can rnams te /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba'i rang bzhin can rnams te /
translated: That which arises is that which has the nature of arising from the three realms.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa nyan thos kyi 'bras bu rnams dang / sa dang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa nyan thos kyi 'bras bu rnams dang / sa dang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The results of the sravakas, such as the fruit of the stream-winner, the stages of the bodhisattva such as the first stage, the factors of enlightenment, the perfections, etc., are the causes for attaining nirvana.

original: mi 'byung ba rnams ni de las bzlog pa 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba rnams ni de las bzlog pa 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The non-arising of these is the opposite of that, i.e., the dharmas which are the causes of samsara.

original: chos 'grib pa'i tshul can dang khyad par gyi tshul can rnams zhes bya ba la 'grib @49b pa'i tshul can gyi chos ni shes bya dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos 'grib pa'i tshul can dang khyad par gyi tshul can rnams zhes bya ba la 'grib @49b pa'i tshul can gyi chos ni shes bya dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnams so //
translated: The dharmas which are the modes of decrease and the modes of distinction are the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions, which are the dharmas of decrease.

original: khyad par gyi chos ni sgrib pa de gnyis kyi gnyen por gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi chos ni sgrib pa de gnyis kyi gnyen por gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The antidotes to those two obscurations are the dharmas of distinction.

original: so so'i skya bo'i chos dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so'i skya bo'i chos dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The dharmas of the ordinary person and the dharmas of the ƒÅrya are the dharmas of the ordinary person and the ƒÅryas.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos ni mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa phyin ci log tu spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos ni mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa phyin ci log tu spyod pa rnams so //
translated: The qualities of ordinary people are the inverted practices of regarding the impermanent as permanent, the painful as pleasant, the impure as pure, and the selfless as having a self.

original: 'phags pa'i chos ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The qualities of the noble ones are the opposite of that.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs par lta ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba la sogs par lta ba'o //
translated: They are the views of impermanence, pain, selflessness, impurity, and so on.

original: slob pa'i chos dang mi slob pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: slob pa'i chos dang mi slob pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The qualities of those in training and the qualities of those beyond training.

original: slob pa'i chos ni rgyun tu zhugs pa nas phyir mi ldog pa'i bar gyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: slob pa'i chos ni rgyun tu zhugs pa nas phyir mi ldog pa'i bar gyi chos rnams so //
translated: The qualities of those in training are the qualities of those from the stage of the stream-enterer up to the stage of the non-returner.

original: mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i chos so //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i chos so //
translated: Those beyond training are the qualities of the stage of the arhat.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos kyi chos ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas are the practices such as entering through the four noble truths and so on.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rtogs pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rtogs pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas are the entry into the realization of dependent origination, and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The dharmas of the bodhisattvas and the dharmas of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa bcu'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa bcu'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams so //
translated: The dharmas of the bodhisattvas are the practices of the bodhisattvas from the stage of devoted conduct up to the tenth stage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni de'i 'bras bur gyur pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni de'i 'bras bur gyur pa /
translated: The dharmas of the buddhas are the results of those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar gtogs pa /
translated: They belong to the stage of buddhahood.

original: ye shes lnga dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o//üîΩchos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sngar smos pa'i chos thams cad mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes lnga dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o// chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sngar smos pa'i chos thams cad mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: They are the five knowledges, the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on.üîΩDesiring to perfect all dharmas means that all the dharmas mentioned previously are taught in summary.

original: mdor na ji skad du smos pa'i chos thams cad kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: mdor na ji skad du smos pa'i chos thams cad kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rtogs te /
translated: In brief, one should realize all the dharmas mentioned as they are in reality, in terms of the characteristics of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: mthar phyin par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who wish to perfect it should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid khong du chud par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gong du smos ba'i chos rnams @50a * //
analyzed: chos 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid khong du chud par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gong du smos ba'i chos rnams @50a * //
translated: Those who wish to comprehend the thusness of all phenomena of the past, future, and present, and so on, the bodhisattvas on the ten grounds,

original: kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: in order to attain the qualities of realizing the ultimate nature of the phenomena mentioned above, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin nyid dang / mi skye ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de bzhin nyid dang / mi skye ba dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The ultimate nature is called thusness, non-arising, and the perfect limit.

original: de dag gi mthar phyin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gi mthar phyin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who wish to perfect those should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ye shes dang / mthu dang / rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad pas khyad zhugs bar 'phags te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ye shes dang / mthu dang / rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad pas khyad zhugs bar 'phags te /
translated: One who wishes to go before all the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas means that a bodhisattva abiding on the ten levels, by means of his wisdom, power, miracles, and so forth, is superior to all the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and is exalted.

original: gtso bor gyur /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur /
translated: He becomes the chief,

original: dam par gyur /
analyzed: dam par gyur /
translated: he becomes the best,

original: phul du gyur pa la sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phul du gyur pa la sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he becomes the foremost.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One who wishes to attain such qualities should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad la rim gror bya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad la rim gror bya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One who wishes to serve all the Buddha Bhagavans means

original: sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob pa'i mthu dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la skad cig yud tsam thang cig la yang bla na med pa'i rim gro bsam gyis mi khyab pa mdzad pa'i mthu mnga' ba /
analyzed: sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob pa'i mthu dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la skad cig yud tsam thang cig la yang bla na med pa'i rim gro bsam gyis mi khyab pa mdzad pa'i mthu mnga' ba /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the ten levels have attained power and by their magical power they can in an instant, in a moment, in a short time, perform inconceivable, unsurpassable service to the Lord Buddhas.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúattaining such qualities.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi nang gi 'khor du gyur par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi nang gi 'khor du gyur par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who wish to be in the inner retinue of all the Lord Buddhas

original: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi sar skye ba gcig gis thogs shing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dar las chod pa tsam du zad pas sangs rgyas kyi 'khor du nye ba'i phyir nang gi 'khor zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi sar skye ba gcig gis thogs shing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dar las chod pa tsam du zad pas sangs rgyas kyi 'khor du nye ba'i phyir nang gi 'khor zhes bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the ten levels are impeded by only one birth to the level of buddhahood, and they are so close to the gnosis of omniscience that they are like a hand‚Äôs breadth from it. For this reason, they are called the inner retinue of the Buddha.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Those who wish to attain such qualities should

original: 'khor mang po dang ldan par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor mang po dang ldan par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since he wishes to have a great retinue means

original: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar gyur pas /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas dang 'dra bar gyur pas /
translated: that since the bodhisattvas on the tenth level become like buddhas,

original: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i nang na mthu che zhing rdzu 'phrul chen po rnams kyis mchod cing bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i nang na mthu che zhing rdzu 'phrul chen po rnams kyis mchod cing bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: they are the objects of worship and honor of the gods such as Indra and Brahma who have great power and great miracles.

original: 'khor de lta bu mang po dang ldan par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor de lta bu mang po dang ldan par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of since he wishes to have a great retinue is that.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams @50b sa 'og ma'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'khor du bskor cing bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams @50b sa 'og ma'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'khor du bskor cing bkur sti bya ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: Since he wishes to obtain a retinue of bodhisattvas means that the bodhisattvas on the tenth level are the objects of worship and honor surrounded by the bodhisattvas on the lower levels.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of since he wishes to obtain such qualities is that.

original: sbyin bdag thams cad kyi sbyin pa yongs su dag par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan thams cad kyi mthar phyin pas bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag thams cad kyi sbyin pa yongs su dag par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yon tan thams cad kyi mthar phyin pas bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who wishes for the purification of the generosity of all benefactors is one who wishes to become a field of merit by perfecting all good qualities, like the bodhisattvas on the tenth ground.

original: sbyin pa la thogs pa med pa'i sems dang ldan par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i mi mthun ba'i phyogs cung zad kyang med pa
analyzed: sbyin pa la thogs pa med pa'i sems dang ldan par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i mi mthun ba'i phyogs cung zad kyang med pa

analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: sems can thams cad sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la dgod par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos bshad cing sems can gyi don du sbyar ba rnams la thogs pa med de /

original: ji ltar sbyar ba de bzhin du 'grub pas don med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyar ba de bzhin du 'grub pas don med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /

analyzed: sems can rnams bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po lnga la 'god pa don med par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan thob par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: mig lnga rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sgrub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku'i spyan ni sha'i mig go //
analyzed: mig lnga rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sgrub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku'i spyan ni sha'i mig go //

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyi mig go //

translated: The knowledge of the path that leads everywhere, the knowledge of the various faculties, the knowledge of the various aspirations, and the knowledge of the various elements is the Dharma eye.

translated: Moreover, ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who wishes to retain in memory all the Dharma that the Blessed Buddhas teach in the ten directions, without interruption, by the power and force of memory,üîΩand who wishes not to lose any of it until unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

translated: One should train in this perfection of wisdom if one wishes to attain such a quality as the ability to hear, retain, and then teach to others in a single moment, a single instant, a single second, all the twelve branches of the Tathagata's scriptures.
